job_description:
As a Supply Chain Analyst, you will play a key role in building the supply chain infrastructure at Lexington Medical and contribute to the overall growth of Lexington Medical. You will be involved in material planning and procurement, inventory management, cost control and supplier management, and have a direct impact on the companyâ€™s important metrics of delivery and quality.Our ideal candidate is sharp, hands-on, data-driven individual and interested in being part of a dynamic and exciting entrepreneurial environment.
What youâ€™ll do:
Manage inventory levels, plan and purchase customized components, commodities, raw materials and services following established procedures. Assist in Materials Requirement Planning. Process internal purchase requisitions as requested.
Provide analyses of product cost structure, identify COGS improvement opportunities. Identify opportunities to improve delivery, quality, and efficiency.
Administer supplier evaluations, scorecards, and ranking systems. Provide inputs for Quarterly Management Review. Assist in new supplier development. Assist in qualifying and monitoring suppliers, maintain an Approved Supplier List.
Work with Contract Manufacturers and Internal Operations on inventory consolidation. Partner with operations for physical inventory activities.
What you'll bring to the table:
Bachelorâ€™s degree in business or technical field of study, with an excellent GPA from a top-tier institution
Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment

About us:
Lexington Medical, a venture-backed company founded by a seasoned team with a proven track record, is a leading provider of FDA-approved and CE Marked surgical devices to address one of the largest unmet needs in medical devices. We are extremely selective in our hiring and employ a small team of highly-talented individuals whose aim is to have a major impact. This is your opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of millions of patients worldwide.

This role will Better the Days of both our internal and external customers by supporting operations across our Philz retail stores and Roasting Plant. The Supply Chain Analyst will focus on daily responsibilities such as inventory management, product catalogs, and systems admin, as well as near-term and long-term strategic initiatives. The position will work closely with key stakeholders across multiple departments including Retail Operations & Product Innovation, Strategic Sourcing, Coffee Roasting & Production Operations, Logistics & Distribution, and Finance.
We are seeking an individual with an entrepreneurial mindset who is sincere, creative, a team player, and has an affinity for data/analytics. Philz is a rapidly growing company and this role requires learning agility and an action-driven approach from day one.

â— Customer-first focus and a passion for Bettering Peopleâ€™s Days
â— 0-2 years relevant experience; Food or Retail industry experience is preferred
â— BA/BS preferably with an analytical focus (Business, Economics, Accounting, Supply Chain, etc)
â— Support timely and/or urgent data requests; ability to track and understand relevant metrics across Supply Chain and Retail functions, with a particular focus on food product assortment and sourcing, and coffee production analysis.
â— Experience with inventory modules and/or ERP Systems; Netsuite experience is preferred
â— Experience with analytics and data visualization platforms (DOMO, Tableau, Qlik, etc)
â— Strong quantitative skills. A Demonstrated data-driven approach to solving problems.
â— Knowledgeable to expert skills in Excel and PowerPoint

INVESTORS TITLE INSURANCE COMPANY

Senior Business Analyst / Consultant


Morrisville, NC

Investors Title Insurance Company’s engineering team is in the final stages of building a high-performing team and are looking for the right business architect / analyst to serve in cross functional roles to capitalize on business opportunities. This includes defining objectives and supporting requirements for business process and software development.
A successful candidate must be highly self-motivated, self-directed, and want to be part of an organization committed to continual improvement and organizational excellence.
Must be a leader that will provide direction, guidance and concise communications necessary to drive progress and shared understanding on projects, from individual contributors to the executive team.
Must have a track record demonstrating resourceful success in these endeavors
JOB QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS
ESSENTIAL
Education: B.S. degree in business administration, finance or a B.A. degree in communications or English, or equivalent experience.
Experience:
3-5 years as a BA analyzing business needs for problem resolution and documenting requirements for the software development team. 5-7 years in a team oriented, collaborate software engineering environment.
Experience in selecting vendor and software solutions that meet or exceed expectations from both project execution and business performance perspectives.
Skills:
Ability to elicit, discern, and align requirements from cross-functional stakeholders and translate them into actionable, consumable and concise documents.
Ability to learn the business at an organizational level to provide meaningful input on solutions and process improvements.
Excellent analytical, organization and creative problem-solving skills.
Proven oral and written communication skills using both technical and audience- appropriate business language.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities simultaneously.
Excellent meeting and workshop facilitation skills that drive to timely results; especially skilled in facilitating problem solving and decision making across diverse groups.
Ability to develop strong relationships with stakeholders and challenge thinking where appropriate throughout business design and requirements elicitation phases.
DESIRED
Experience: 3-5 years serving in a business consultancy role, working with businesses to improve processes and solve business issues. Personal experience working with insurance, real estate, mortgage banking business functions / software.
Skills: Personal experience with accounting and financial business functions / software. Excellent ability to analyze and document workflow and improve processing efficiencies.
JOB FUNCTIONS
Review, analyze and evaluate ideas, projects and opportunities to develop new products, services and business models leveraging technology as it makes sense for the business segments.
Conduct analysis to determine best options and approach for solving business problems/opportunities that may include process improvement, systems enhancement, user training, and/or software procurement.
Evaluate and present information that will facilitate effective and timely decision-making through written and oral communication materials that effectively summarize findings with recommendations.
Meet with decision makers, system owners and end users to define business, financial and operational requirements and system goals and identify and resolve system issues.
Draft and communicate project artifacts, including business cases, scope documents, full-scale project plans, requirements documents, status reports, and supporting analysis documents.
Refine customer driven requirements focusing on solutions that deliver the most strategic value to our customers at the right cost.
Evaluate and understand the experience and skill level of team members to capitalize on team strengths. Customize communications to be most effective with each audience.
Ensure that there is appropriate level of support and cooperation between project groups.
The Company

Recognized as an industry leader, Investors Title Insurance Company provides residential and commercial title insurance and innovative business solutions for our partners. The Company has been recognized with an AM Best rating of A, assigned a Financial Stability Rating of A” Unsurpassed from Demotech and a Kroll Rating of A. Working at Investors Title, you will find a dynamic and supportive culture, the training and development you need to succeed, a variety of career paths, work/life balance, and excellent benefits.

The Company is an equal opportunity employer. As such, the Company offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status and other protected class characteristics.

Develop test plans and execute test scripts based on business and functional requirements in coordination with the systems administrator and business partners.

Basic Purpose

Lending Analytics Business Intelligence and Data Science team is seeking a leader who enjoys transforming data into insights! The ideal candidate has a passion for data analysis, technology and helping people leverage technology to transform business and reporting processes. As a Business Operations Analyst, you will be part of a dynamic cross-functional team that is responsible for providing analysis of lending product performance within a risk framework including new business, portfolio management, loss mitigation, and developing innovative reporting and analysis solutions to support the achievement of strategic risk management goals.

Responsibilities include:
Building partnerships with business units and developing technical solutions for reporting and analytic needs
Participation in the full life cycle of a project including requirements, prototyping, design, development, testing and implementation
Assessing data flow processes and identifying areas for further automation and optimization
Leading working sessions with dynamic cross-functional team to develop dashboards
Performing data profiling and data blending by combining data from multiple data sources using SQL, SAS, SPSS, JMP, R, Python, Tableau or Power BI
Developing accurate and insightful visualizations for dashboards
Preparing data, reports, agenda and themes for strategic risk management (SRM) presentations
Nimble problem solving and willingness to do “whatever it takes” to deliver business value quickly
Leading training sessions for business users and teammates
Researching and reading about new technology in business intelligence and machine learning
Qualifications:
Minimum of 1-2 years of experience developing analytics reporting solutions using Tableau, Power BI or other business intelligence and dashboard design software
Minimum of 1-2 years of experience writing SQL for report development and optimizing query performance
Lending product knowledge and experience in at least one product including credit cards, consumer loans, education lending and/or mortgage and equity
Experience in statistics, modeling, machine learning, forecasting and cost benefit analysis
Knowledge of data transformation, modeling and/or ETL tools such as SAS, SPSS, JMP, R, Python, Tableau Prep or Alteryx
Ability to use various data analysis techniques to collect, explore, and identify the right data to be visualized in a business intelligence tool
Creative mind and eye for design with prior UX/UI experience and knowledge of reporting and dashboard best practices and visualization standards
Ability to perform data discovery, validation and find patterns and relationships in data
Organizational skills and the ability to multi-task by prioritizing assignments and working independently to ensure work is completed on schedule and
BS Degree in Finance, Computer Science or related field

Advanced Degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science or related field

What We Are Looking For

NEP is currently seeking a dynamic individual to become part of our Analytics team as a Business Data Analyst.

This position is responsible for fulfilling the information requests of key decision makers within the University by directly querying against the SQL database, ensuring the accuracy and relevance of that information, and providing access to information in a seamless and timely manner in the form of data extracts, SSRS reports, BI Reports, dashboards, and analytics. The Business Data Analyst interprets results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation to complex data mining. Designs, develops, implements and maintains business solutions. This position also fulfills information and data requests from external stakeholders.

NEP will not sponsor applicants for work visas or STEM-OPT.

Essential Functions
Uses Structured Query Language (SQL) to gather and assess data from the reporting database, transactional database, operational data store, and external systems to assist university leadership in decision making.
Supports the University’s continuous quality improvement efforts through the use of performance metrics development and monitoring.
Continually assesses data quality throughout the database and coordinates with IT in the correction of source data or creation of translation sources, where applicable.
Continually researches and identifies best practices for business data analysis via published literature, formalized training and professional development efforts.
Authenticates and interprets data based on results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.
Communicates and disseminates the results of information gathering using BI software, SSRS, and Excel.
Collects and reports data in adherence to Federal and State reporting requirements.
Perform other duties as assigned
Reasonable and consistent attendance to fulfill requirements of the position
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Expert in SQL query writing.
Familiarity with push button reporting solutions – Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Studio (SSRS) highly preferred.
Proficient in Visual Studio.
Expert in Excel pivot tables and charts.
Ability to work closely with business owners to determine meaningful metrics and fulfill reporting needs.
Ability to work closely with IT to develop database structure.
Work with senior leadership to create and analyze reports and ad hoc data requests for decision making.
Skill in operating equipment, such as personal computer, fax, copier, phone system.
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
Ability to communicate clearly to a variety of constituents in both verbal and written communication.
Attention to detail, highly organized, and ability to execute multiple initiatives within budgeted timeframes.Proficient with Microsoft Word and other applications in the Microsoft Office suite
Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree with focus in business or related field required
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience conducting data analyses, developing metrics, and creating reports required
Proficient in query design, generation, and reporting; SQL and SSRS (2008 SQL Server Reporting Services) required.
Experience with the online delivery of education preferred.
Experience in higher education preferred
Experience working in a technology-driven enterprise preferred
All skills, abilities and education will be considered for minimum qualifications
Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. The physical requirements for performing the essential functions of this position require the team member to be able to:
Able to sit, stand, kneel, walk, and reach.
Able to lift, push, pull, and/or move up to 20 pounds.
Hear well enough to communicate with others.
Read a computer screen and written material.
Write, type, and use phone system.
Working Conditions

This position operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

• Good working environment with the absence of disagreeable conditions.

• The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

• Regular and reliable attendance is required.

NEP will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Who We Are

National Education Partners (NEP) provides premier online program management (OPM) services for leading educational institutions. NEP offers a rich history of delivering traditional academic operations support in areas such as finance, human resources, enrollment, financial aid, marketing, information technology and much more. Today, NEP is the OPM of record for Northcentral University (NCU), which offers doctoral, master’s and bachelor’s degrees in business, technology, education, and psychology, as well as doctoral and master’s degrees in healthcare and marriage and family therapy. NEP also provides online services to John F. Kennedy University. Both NEP and NCU are part of the National University System, a system of nonprofit universities with its headquarters in La Jolla, California.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst - Global Supply Chain
job_description:
Position:
Senior Financial Analyst - Global Supply Chain
Job Description:


Supply Chain Finance Sr. Analyst Position Description

In order to address business continuity risk with the current resources and build out talent within the Global Supply Chain Finance team as part of the newly created Global Components Finance team, the team is seeking Senior Financial Analyst with prior experience in the Global Supply Chain Finance organization of large company.

The Sr. Financial Analyst will work with Arrow Global Supply Chain organization to provide global financial reporting and analysis across multiple Business Units and regions. This position reports to the Supply Chain Finance Manager and is a key business partner to our Director & VP level operations leaders in managing their P&Ls and budgets. The role will provide analysis of the organizations financial performance against plan and forecast, perform monthly budget variance analysis and will prepare financial reports, charts, and other project analytics as necessary.

This role is expected to identify the opportunities and drive process improvements within Supply Chain Finance organization; create executive level analytics and reporting that track, identify trends and root causes and enable senior level leaders to make informed decisions to drive improved financial and operational performance. Prior experience within Supply Chain and Logistics is a must; preferably with experience within a large global manufacturing or distribution environment. This position requires 7+ years of Supply Chain experience.

The perfect candidate would be a self-motivated analytical thinker with superb communication skills that would drive results with little to no supervision. Other success factors for this role include being experienced in driving change in a fast-paced dynamic environment, responding to issues and request with a sense of urgency, ability to multi-task, being resourceful and having a global mindset.

What Will Help You Succeed Even More
Experience supporting distribution, manufacturing, and/or production service businesses
5+ years of experience in business analytics
Advanced degree and financial certifications (MBA, MSF, CFA, CPA, etc.) a plus
Advanced Microsoft Office skills MS Excel, MS Power Point
SQL and Power BI proficiency are a plus
Global experience
Fortune 200 Business Finance / FP&A experience
Experience managing cross functional projects

Ryan Specialty Group (RSG) is an international specialty insurance organization that provides innovative solutions for brokers, agents and insurance carriers. The RSG family includes a wholesale brokerage operation, RT Specialty (RT), and a collection of managing general underwriting companies within RSG Underwriting Managers (RSGUM). RSG was founded by Mr. Patrick G. Ryan, the retired Chairman and CEO of Aon Corporation. A highly regarded insurance veteran, Mr. Ryan saw the need for a specialty organization devoted exclusively to creating sophisticated insurance and risk management solutions for a select group of hard-to-place risks. With its mission of delivering measurable value, RSG is committed to providing specialty insurance services, proven leadership, outstanding industry experience and quality services in all of our exchanges with retail agents and brokers, and insurance carriers worldwide.

RSGUM, a division of Ryan Specialty Group is looking for an Business Development Executive to join our Scottsdale, AZ office. We are a fast paced, energetic and rapidly growing organization that offers a great opportunity for someone interested in further developing their career.
Position Summary:
The Business Development Executive will primarily focus on building high end MGA broker relationships and driving submission activity in the assigned region. The candidate will assist in providing, sales, marketing and business development support to the assigned region as well as assist the underwriting team with important agency relationships. Job Summary

The demand planner is a highly-visible position responsible for maintaining all monthly operational forecasts. The role will drive collaboration with Merchandising, Sales and Finance to reconcile forecast gaps and adjust the baseline forecast. The role will also identify trends, monitor historical sales and support the development of strategies to achieve division revenue goals.

Essential Responsibilities
For each forecast milestone event, validate the channel roll-up of sales, margin, and style/color productivity metrics to meet team, channel, region, and company goals
Assist in setting team goals for revenue, gross margin, inventory, and style/color productivity that meet overall channel/regional financial metrics
Maintain Demand Plans for supporting channels and manage forecasts in ERP systems. Ensure data accuracy in reporting and management of forecasts.
Maintain forecasts in Demand Planning System:
Assist in seasonal Ranges and plan assortment with support from Merchandising, Sales and Product
Assist in product/style ranking, collect feedback and develop top down forecasts
YoY Trend analysis, manage product mix and comp-style mapping
Maintain size distribution for assigned region/channels
Manage 12-18mo statistical forecasts for TOMS core assortment, update monthly
Provide analysis to support decisions to deploy in-season promotional and markdown strategies that meet inventory and financial goals
Work across the matrix to insure all necessary data is available and accurately noted so financial metrics can be validated
Communicate risks and opportunities to stakeholders and senior leadership
Collaborate with Merchants, Buyers, and Supply Chain Management on seasonal channel buy strategies to support product initiatives, maximize in-stock, and inventory productivity
Provide ongoing communication to the relevant teams/stakeholders regarding channel financial performance
Support Demand Planning in monthly and seasonal product adoption events, sales forecast meetings, and S&OP meetings. Develop content to support and assist in demand reviews.
Other duties as assigned

SAP BI or Query experience (3+ years)
Strong analytical capabilities
Tableau - preferred
Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP)
Ability to collaborate and influence cross-functionally

Demand Planning experience required - preferably in a wholesale environment

Syniti, formerly BackOffice Associates, was founded to solve business’ complex data challenges, bringing synergy between data and business, delivering confidence and progress along clients’ business transformation journey. Through a combination of unique data expertise, services, and intelligent software leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning, we help clients manage their data journey from data conversion to data quality, data archival and replication, master data management, analytics, information governance, and data strategy.

Utilizing the market’s top data specialists, validated industry knowledge and proven methodologies, Syniti has led thousands of successful data journey projects for Forbes Global 2000 organizations. SAP resells Advance Data Migration and Information Steward Accelerator by BackOffice Associates as SAP Solution Extensions.

Syniti is a purpose-driven company. “We’re embracing the future together as one – with our employees, clients and partners – accelerating global and human progress, one data challenge at a time.”

Headquartered in Boston, MA, Syniti operates in 25 countries around the globe.

Position Summary


As a Data Analyst, you will help our clients address some of their biggest data challenges. You will develop a diverse set of core consulting skills, such as business analysis, process improvement and technical expertise. You will be a key contributor to the consulting team at different phases of the project including discovery, solution generation, design/architecture and the detailing of the overall process. Over time, you’ll play a pivotal role in helping us drive the successful delivery of new solutions to our clients every day.

Primary Responsibilities:
Deliver unique technology and business solutions to clients across industries, including; Financial Services, Pharma & Life Sciences, Manufacturing and Utilities
Work closely with other consultants on customer site as a part of small to large size project teams
Participate in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues
Conduct requirements analysis, data analysis and create reports
Assist in the customization and configuration of the solution
Maintain responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products
Actively expand consulting skills and professional development through training courses, mentoring, and daily interaction with clients
Observe and foster best practices in business process design and implementation
Maintain engagement utilization requirement
Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related analytical or technical disciplines
1+ years of ERP techno-functional or functional experience, SAP preferred
Proficient in MS SQL (query skills, table structure and relational databases)
Experience with data quality analysis, statistical analysis and/or modeling
Experience mining and analyzing transactional electronic data with competency in one or more of the following: SAS, SQL or other software tools
Advanced proficiency with MS Office Suite, specifically Excel, Office and Word
Experience using collaboration tools such as Skype, Zoom, Hangouts, Slack etc
Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives
Demonstrated ability to present clearly, succinctly and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience
Superior customer service skills, preferably demonstrated by experience working directly with customers
Ability to adapt to changing environments and pick up new skills quickly
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-starter with the ability to self-motivate in fast paced environments
Strong drive for achieving results under pressure
Syniti offers a generous benefits package that includes medical, 401k, long term disability, life insurance and a paid time off program.

If you are interested in this or any one of the exciting career opportunities at Syniti®, please go to www.syniti.com and view our Careers section, where you should complete the on-line application process.

At Cengage, we are harnessing the power of tech to build a future where all learners have the tools and confidence to achieve their goals.

As a Cengage employee, you will blaze a new trail to transform the way people learn. Collaborating with the best of the best, you will feel challenged and inspired to do breakthrough work. With the support of our united team, there is no limit to what you can imagine, create and set in motion.

Are we right for you?


We set the bar higher by bringing our unique talents and point of view to the table every day. We are curious and comfortable with change and are willing to take risks to transform education. Most importantly, with everything we do, we put learning first.

What You'll Do Here:


The Data Analyst, Product Data Analytics will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights across the finance, product, strategy, technology, and legal groups designed to significantly improve Cengage’s Higher Education and Skills product and content development. The Data Analyst will be a critical contributor to the team, focusing on deriving business outcomes from data, driving improvements in data quality, building out new proof of concepts, engaging and communicating analysis to cross-functional teams, and providing analytic and operational support to multiple areas.Cengage Learning is a collaborative environment. This role will bring data-first thinking to projects that are transformational in nature. The right candidate will possess strategic thinking, effective problem structuring, proven analytical skills, and an ability to influence within diverse teams.

This position is full-time, on-site in one of the following locations: Boston, MA/Mason, OH/Clifton Park, NY.

· Form a deep understanding of Cengage Learning’s product data, processes, systems and tools, while shaping workflow best practices and improving data integrity· Assist in structuring and executing operational and strategic initiatives by gathering and synthesizing relevant data, leading analyses, and developing final recommendations and documentation· Drive analysis to recommendations to meaningful operating results, such as higher quality, faster cycle times, less costly, etc.· Capture and communicate findings within broader project structure; maintain healthy project management practices, including work plan development and trackingTo successfully accomplish the above, engage with and on cross-functional teams

· BA/BS with high proven achievement· Minimum 3 years of experience working directly with complex data systems · Demonstrated ability to conceive and execute quantitative analysis and deliver data-driven insights· Outstanding organizational skills and a very strong attention to detail· Demonstrated writing and verbal presentation skills enabling her/him to prepare and present information and recommendations to a diverse and often senior audience· Proven commitment to providing excellent customer service to internal and external stakeholders; demonstrated willingness to take ownership of customer issues and see them through to resolution· Collaborative problem solving and working style to drive change through influence· Able to self-manage progress against milestones and deliverables with a high degree of accountability and personal urgency· Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite of systems, particularly MS Excel and MS Access

sales support role

GENERAL SUMMARY:
The Financial & Accounting Specialist/Junior Data Analyst is responsible for the daily activities related to capital expenditures: project review and set-up, spend follow-up, variance analysis, month-end journal entry preparation and assets tracking.
In close collaboration with the members of the FP&A department and of our Regional Companies, the Finance and Accounting Specialist will support the FP&A department’s financial analysis and internal reporting needs in such areas as: same-store sales, sales by major product group, pricing, margins and operating costs.

The Financial & Accounting Specialist will also support the optimization of data mining, report production and data modeling through the use of various software, reporting systems and programming languages.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Involved in the entire lifecycle of capital expenditures, from the review of the initial request to the retirement of the asset
• Works in close partnership with the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis and the Senior Analysts of the Department in order to learn the necessary skills to be successful in this role
• Supports the department efforts to improve data mining
• Assist in the month end closing process including preparation and/or review of journal entries as well as preparation of financial statements.
• Provides financial modeling support to the FP&A department
• Supports the reporting and analyzing functions of the FP&A department
• Special projects and other duties as assigned

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
To perform this position successfully, an associate must be able to perform each job duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable associates with disabilities to perform the essential duties.

Required Education:
• Bachelor’s degree in finance, information science or related field

Required Length & Type of Experience:
• Minimum of two years financial or business analysis experience preferred
• Familiarity with financial statements and investment decision concepts such as Net Present Value (NPV) and Internal Rate of Return (IRR)
• Knowledge of industrial companies a plus

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities (KSA’s):
• Strong organizational, analytical and communication skills
• Ability to work with a wide variety of people with different personalities / backgrounds
• Ability to navigate within a complex and fast-paced organization
• Ability to demonstrate the capacity to assume increasing responsibilities
• Willing to learn techniques that enhance automation for procedures that become repetitive.
• Familiar with a complex use of Excel including pivot tables, various formulas and Macros
• Experience with SAP, SAP BW, Microsoft Access, SQL, PowerBI (incl. Dax language) strongly encouraged
• Knowledge of programming languages (Python or other) a plus

job_title: Associate Business Management Analyst - Budget, Cost Control, Finance, Pricing (Secret Clearance)
job_description:
Start your future with a new mission: Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS). As a part of the NGMS Team, you'll join experts in developing systems and solutions that keep our world safe. Together we protect our troops, public safety, information, and our planet. It's unique work. It's challenging and rewarding. Most of all, it is work that makes a difference. Join us and launch your career. We'll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of global security.

Northrop Grumman is seeking experienced and motivated professionals for the various entry level roles in Business Management as part of this Profile Requisition. Roles include Associate Program Control Analysts (PCA), Pricing Analysts, Budget Analysts, Rates Analysts, and Financial Analysts. Positions will be located in one of our Mission Systems Sector facilities in the MD area which include locations in Linthicum (BWI), Annapolis Junction, Annapolis, and Sykesville.

Ideal candidates must be able to make sound decisions in a timely manner, display strong interpersonal and leadership skills, and follow compliance protocol.

Roles and responsibilities could encompass the following and vary slightly depending on specific position, program, or business unit to which you are assigned:
Generate program performance measurement baselines (PMB) and implement approved changes
Perform analyses and prepare reports to ensure program contracts are within negotiated, agreed-upon parameters, government cost control guidelines, and accounting guidelines
Perform analyses and prepare program financial reports for internal and external customers relative to program cost incurrence, material tracking, and labor spending
Identify and mitigate program cost and schedule risk
Coordinate and prepare program financial forecasting and reporting, the Annual Operating Plan (AOP), and the Labor Resource Plan
Facilitate, monitor, and forecast program financing mechanisms including Accounts Receivable, Advanced Payments, and Performance Based Payments
Support program audits, reviews, and fact-finding as requested by program customers, audit agencies, and company management
Support program cost estimate development, customer proposals, and negotiation
Perform Earned Value Management (EVM) tasks including developing the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and performance measurement baseline (PMB), monitoring and analyzing the Estimate to Complete (ETC), Estimate at Complete (EAC), significant variances, risk management reserve (MR), and financial reserve (FR), and preparing of internal and external status reports
Work cooperatively with the business, functional, and technical staff to address internal and external customer requests


RELOCATION ASSISTANCE IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR THIS REQUISITION .

Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:
A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria.
The candidate must have a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution with 0 years of professional experience in business management, finance, accounting, or related fields
Proficiency in MS Office Suite, specifically a high level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, lookups, chart generation, VBA macros, etc.)
Demonstrated leadership, critical thinking, innovative behaviors, and the ability to multi-task in a challenging environment
The willingness and ability to travel domestically up to 10% of the time (Note that 10% represents the maximum travel amount for some positions included on this requisition but the majority of positions require 0% travel.)
Current active Secret level security clearance.
Preferred Qualifications
Professional experience in a regulated industry such as Aerospace & Defense, Insurance, Financial Services, or Telecommunications.
SAP or COGNOS software tool experience
Earned Value Management customer reporting, MPM, or COBRA experience
Current, active Top Secret clearance or higher.
Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

POSITION SUMMARY:The Supply Chain Analyst is primarily responsible for aspects and components needed to design and procure a balanced, safe, cost effective and service focused transportation network as they relate to the supply chain.The Supply Chain Analyst provides distribution network analysis, carrier performance reporting, and rate management support. As part of their day-to-day activities, they serve as the Transportation Management System Super User with timely and accurate data management, in addition to providing maintenance and improvement of the system, and training for other users. This person must also be comfortable providing recommendations for various process improvements. The Supply Chain Analyst uses their data expertise to design on-going and ad-hoc analysis to measure the impact of regular functions or projects on the transportation network.

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

+ Works closely with Transportation Manager to support the activities associated with the daily implementation of the shipment plan of the Roofing group.

+ Cost savings analysis on RPG transportation-related projects.

+ Owner of the return material and re-consignment process.

+ Carrier EDI and shipment status contact, ensures updates are complete via audits and carrier follow up.

+ Carrier dispatch and freight payment support.

+ Freight financial analysis, report out, benchmarking, and other ad-hoc reporting.

+ Carrier Network KPI creation and maintenance.

+ Troubleshoot payment and billing inquiries from transportation vendors.

+ Owner of Roofing TMS, Dock Scheduler, SAP shipment processes and procedures

+ Responsible for requesting, follow-up, and testing of transportation-related service tickets inclusive of incident reporting and change requests for all systems (TMS, SAP, etc...).

+ Carrier relationship management, inclusive of new carrier set-up, onboarding.

+ Analyze and recommend improvements to both RPG Transportation personnel and other RPG groups on subjects pertinent to transportation.

+ On-boarding and training of various new employees (Load Planners).

+ Creation and maintenance of department KPIs, system process improvements.

+ Point of contact in manager's absence.

+ Regular reporting of key metrics, demand planning forecast reports, in addition to special requests/ad-hoc reporting from business.

+ Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain or equivalent work experience.

+ Five years of Transportation industry knowledge: Load planning, customer service, or dispatch experience in manufacturing or distribution environment.

+ Ability to meet established scheduling parameters with minimal guidance.

+ Strong systems aptitude, with experience in ERP, Warehouse Management and/or Transportation Management systems (SAP and Manhattan Associates a plus).

+ Strong data-mining capabilities including excellent database skills (e.g. Microsoft Access). Familiarity with Open Database Connections to retrieve and analyze data. Experience creating and structuring database tables, queries and relationships.

+ Strong analytical skills and MS Office Suite proficiency.

+ Knowledge of BI tools such as Qlikview and Tableu a plus.

+ Very good verbal and written communication skills.

Overview

The Business Data Analyst provides analytical, planning, coordination, and implementation support to performance improvement activities and projects across VNSNY CHOICE Health Plans. Assists department leadership with tracking implementation and monitoring organizational change effectiveness, providing insights using analytical tools for data collections and analysis as well as designing analytical approaches.

Responsibilities
Develops a strong understanding of all VNSNY CHOICE Health Plans strategic business objectives and business unit operations. Assists department with designing and evaluating data and reports. Provides data collection, analytical support to team and monitors assigned projects.
Defines core processes and maps current states for redesign projects; assists with solution design.
Collects and analyzes performance and outcome data. Summarizes, creates, and distributes reports as needed. Ensures deliverables are completed on time; responds to changing project circumstances and communicates issues to project leadership.
Supports Clinical Operations by generating daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly reports from data cubes using MicroStrategy; creates FLASH reports to monitor and evaluate performance.
Performs cost-impact analysis on UM medical appeals on a monthly basis by generating attributed values using complex Excel formulas.
Utilizes SAS and SQL skills to extract Claims data from data warehouse and ensure data quality; analyzes data to provide recommendations and insights.
Creates interactive dashboards to analyze Key Performance Indicators trends and presents data visually using Tableau. Generates reports for ODAG and CMS from Oracle OBIEE and evaluates the timeliness of standard and expedited org determinations.
Qualifications
Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Electronics/Communication Engineering, or a related field required. Master's Degree in one of the above-described disciplines preferred.
Experience: Minimum three years progressive data analyst work experience in various PC database applications, preferably in the healthcare industry, required. Experience with MicroStrategy, SAS, Tableau, MS Excel, Word, Access and PowerPoint preferred. Proficient with personal computers, including Microsoft Windows Excel, Word, Access, Power Point required.
Project management and facilitation skills required.

Position overview
The Business Analyst will support the information needs of the business. He/she will gather and analyze data requirements to support pipeline and CRM applications, ad-hoc reporting, and self-service analytics platforms. He/she will be responsible for developing and managing processes, information flows, and data governance standards across various systems and business groups.

Monitor, analyze and report key revenue performance drivers including market penetration and pricing
Responsible for the capture, delivery, and record-keeping of business information needs such as forecasting, variance analysis, identification and communication of risks & opportunities, industry & competitive analysis, board meeting support and financial closes.
Will collaborate with team members on the development of analytical models, interactive self-service dashboards, and guided reporting tools to support prospect, customer, sales and financial metrics reporting across the organization.
Establish and maintain strong relationships with all key stakeholders in Sales, Technology, Marketing and Finance to ensure consistent and open dialogue and a combined commitment to process improvements and data cleanliness.
Support VP and CEO in budget planning process, monthly financial close, and corporate forecast reporting
Display ingenuity through development of new analytical products that improve story-telling and issue identification
Work with internal and external stakeholders to develop tools and services such as modeling, dashboards, hypothesis generation and testing, scorecards, and data insights
Consult with departments across the organization to understand, document, and analyze data requirements and translate those requirements into analytics/reporting requirements
Conceptualize, design, and support the implementation of analytics and reports for business partners
Identify business data needs (and gaps) to support business goals
Stay current with new analytical tools and industry trends
Map business processes and data flow across systems and business groups

Bachelor's degree in Accounting/Finance/Business or Information Systems

Strong analytical skills, critical thinking, decision support and performance analysis, forecasting, and planning

Ability to professionally interacting with all levels of co-workers.
Excellent project management, communication, analytical, and problem solving skills

Ability to independently manage workload with regard to prioritization and time

The Customer Supply Chain Analyst will be responsible for working with our customer supply chain team to create demand and reduce costs. In this role, the analyst will support the Customer Supply Chain Team Leader with data and insights that facilitate the development of industry best practice policies. A key focus will be on reducing Ghirardelli's non trade sales costs, including unsaleables and returns by fully implementing GCC policies and driving compliance with top customers. To facilitate efficient cost management, this individual will be responsible for tracking, reporting, identifying gaps/risks, and creating solutions for management of non-compliance.

The Customer Supply Chain Analyst will also work with key Grocery accounts/Account Managers to verify forecasts, demand planning to ensure demand signal is being passed to supply planning, and supply planning in production. The Customer Supply Chain Analyst will also work with deployment to fulfill customer orders. The Customer Supply Chain Analyst will also work with key Grocery accounts on Supply Chain efficiencies, including data sharing and use cases associated with customer data, inventory management, and improving forecast accuracy.

Develop and Implement Industry-Based Supply Chain Policies
Analyze numerous sources of customer and 3rd party data to generate insights and recommendations to support policy implementations around:
Unsaleables (damaged and expired product)
Product returns
Product shelf life
Leverage causal data to make recommendations on internal business activities and customer policies.
Develop and publish both company-wide and customer-specific reporting on:
Customer trade damage levels
Customer compliance with policy
Auditing projects with key customers
Lead the management of delivering against the trade damages and returns annual budgets.
Lead resolution of unsaleables deduction disputes in collaboration with customer teams.
Ad hoc support of Customer Supply Chain Issues/Initiatives
Support and help implement various logistics efficiency initiatives, including customer order sizes, bracket pricing, and shipping network optimization
Customer facing policy implementation (i.e. Sailing Schedule Changes)
Support and as appropriate lead various customer supply chain projects
Manage Shelf life and minimum order exception process
Primary contact for sales interactions with Logistics/Customer Service team
Monthly review of logistics fines
Help Facilitate EDI priority list
Support Key Grocery Customers
Develop solutions to reduce non-trade sales costs, specifically unsaleable items, markdowns, and returns
Identify opportunities and lead implementation of Ghirardelli supply chain policies at key Grocery customer, including order size requirements, order to ship timelines, and working with logistics to mitigate customer fines for Seasonal/Direct areas of the business.
Create reporting and actively communicate performance against established supply chain goals and metrics
Assist and provide deployment recommendations to logistics team based on inventory needs and customer DC locations
Improve Forecast Accuracy by utilizing key Grocery customers data/forecasts/inventory to send best demand signal possible to the internal demand/supply planning team.
Liaison for QA issues in the marketplace
Facilitate QA investigation and findings
Work with Sales Merchandising team to execute corrective actions

Analytical: must be able to determine the root cause of policy and supply chain issues to drive appropriate solutions*
Strong interpersonal skills: Will work with many functions within Ghirardelli to be successful, including sales, customer service, operations and logistics*
Ability to work directly with Ghirardelli customers; must possess leadership qualities and the ability to negotiate mutually beneficial supply chain programs*
Strong project management skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks, adapt to changing priorities, respond with urgency to requests and remain focused on strategic imperatives*
Proficient in Excel, Access, and database management*
EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE
College Degree -- B.S. Required
Breadth and depth of supply chain experience highly desired
Experience working with sophisticated customers with a national presence
A minimum of 3 years in CPG (fast-moving consumer goods) roles in supply chain, forecasting, and/or logistics preferred

Do you have a natural curiosity and a thrill for problem solving data? If so, we are looking for a marketing data story teller with a bit of tech knowledge to serve as Marketing Data Analyst.

The marketing data analyst holds the crucial role of measuring marketing and detailing effectiveness of marketing channels. The analyst will think strategically and source marketing data to proactively identify and interpret key drivers behind marketing performance. The analyst will also collaborate with marketing stakeholders to devise data driven analysis that generates actionable insights to optimize strategic improvements in marketing effectiveness.

This position will manage third party relationships with the goal of creating impactful and informative marketing dashboards to represent marketing performance– preferably in real time– and support self-service analytics.

The analyst will help drive a data culture in the marketing department so that marketing team members collaborate to set campaign measurements before they launch in market, and track and adjust while in market to align towards enterprise goals.

The Marketing Data Analyst or Marketing Data Analyst Sr. will be an analytical and optimization expert for driving improvements for marketing analytics. This includes a balance of data analysis, data visualization, and marketing optimization. By managing the third party vendors providing us the raw data this role is expected to create and maintain a robust analytic foundation to facilitate rapid marketing metric reporting, review, and analysis of key metrics for optimizing marketing channel performance.

Data expertise and insights will be expected to support marketing strategy and targeting aligning with business goals. The analyst will collaborate with the marketing department to drive a cultural change towards a data driven orientation. The data goal for digital marketing will be to track the entire funnel from marketing contact, to visit, to conversion.

Examples of marketing data to track and support optimization may include:
Campaign performance– trigger, lead generating, cross-sell, up-sell, loyalty and prospect
Promotions performance– measurement of short term promotions from both a business and marketing channel effort.
Web site (google analytics big query) including landing pages
Direct mail
Events
Email/text– delivered, opened, CTR
Display, search, social, video– impressions, clicks, costs per impression, impressions by platform, media spend by tactic, conversion
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Collaborate with marketing stakeholders to devise data driven analysis that generates actionable insights to optimize strategic improvements in marketing effectiveness.

Develop efficient queries that incorporate multiple data sources. Work with third party vendor and Ent BI staff on ways to acquire required data for key metrics.

Proactively identify and interpret key drivers behind marketing performance and deliver insights to internal marketing department stakeholders.

Manage relationship with third party vendors to: perform data audit, acquire and aggregate data, access and visualize data.

Other duties as required

Minimum formal education required for this position:

Knowledge consistent with a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Statistics, Economics, Math or similar field of study.

Each year of relevant work experience may be exchanged for a year in a relevant degree program or vice versa. For example, a requirement of“Knowledge Consistent with a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting and 2+ years’ of accounting experience” could be substituted for a High School Diploma and 6 years of relevant accounting work experience or a Master’s Degree in Accounting and 0 years of work experience.

Minimum work experience:

Marketing Data Analyst

2+ years’ experience delivering actionable data insights and partnering with stakeholders about data insights.

1+ years’ experience with digital marketing data (ie Google/Adobe analytics, Adwords)

Marketing Data Analyst Sr.

4+ years’ experience delivering actionable data insights and partnering with stakeholders about data insights.

3+ years’ experience with digital marketing data (ie Google/Adobe analytics, Adwords)

Technical or specialized knowledge/skills:
Experience analyzing marketing data performance.
Skilled in interpreting business measurement / reporting needs.
Able to translate data analysis into business and marketing optimization recommendations.
Experience using data visualization tools for marketing purposes to succinctly convey results / trends and insights.
Knowledge of various marketing channels.
Have a natural curiosity of data to go beyond an initial request to deliver informative marketing data insights.
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, QlikSense, Alteryx or UI Path.
Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite of products (Word/Excel/Outlook/Powerpoint/Access)
Experience with SQL.
(Preferred) Microsoft Azure or similar cloud suites experience.
Certifications required:
None required.
Environmental, physical and psychological requirements:
Must be able to sit or stand for prolonged periods of time in a climate controlled environment. Must be able to use fingers, hands, wrists for repetitive tasks such as typing, using a mouse, handling paper, currency, or coin, and operating a telephone. Demands for visual and auditory acuity are typical of an office environment. Must be able to interact via email, telephone, or in person with diplomacy, tact, and courtesy with all members under varying circumstances. Must be able to lift up to 40 lbs.

Apply

Description

For over two decades, Hourigan has established itself as the “go-to” firm when it comes to managing complex projects and delivering them to the highest standards. Our portfolio is filled with many success stories, but we’re most proud of the strong relationships we have built and continue to grow. Our relationship-centered approach starts with our employees. We are looking for people who embody our values of fairness, integrity, and trust. We want self-starters who take ownership in their work and value building and maintaining relationships every step along the way. We take pride in our desire to become better every day, providing our employees with opportunities to develop both personally and professionally.

We have an opening for an experienced and professional individual to serve as our Data Analyst. The Data Analyst will be responsible for the development and maintenance of ETLs (Extract Transform Load) for the purpose of creating data visualizations to assist company managers in making informed business decisions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• Support project teams in getting data into our BI environment (Domo)

• Create Data transformations using tools embedded within our BI tool

• Work with end users to create data visualizations

• Administer user accounts within DOMO

• Develop data strategies to maximize visualization performance

• Collaborate with DBAs to create reports and write queries

• Maximize efficiency of existing data extractions

• Ensure data is accurate and timely

• Perform other data related tasks as directed

Qualifications and Experience:

• Demonstrated proficiency in Oracle/PL SQL, MySQL, R Programming, Python, and Redshift.

• BI Platform experience. DOMO experience is preferred.

• Microsoft Excel proficiency

• Excellent decision-making skills and solution-oriented

• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

• Detailed, process oriented, organized, and strong at task prioritization

• Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Professional, strong interpersonal skills, and team oriented

• High quality standards and ethics is a must

• Some travel may be required

We offer our full-time employees a competitive benefits package including, but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, and life insurances, short-term and long-term disability, 401k employer match, and paid time off.

The summary of essential duties and responsibilities listed above is not intended to cover all possible job duties and is subject to change at our discretion.

Create reports and dashboards, analyze data and provide business insights
Continuously improve and optimize processes through automation
Stay current with SFDC features and leverage them as needed
Perform general SFDC configuration as needed

At least 5 years of SFDC platform experience and comfortable building flows

Proven track record of successfully documenting and communicating complex business requirements for both technical and non-technical audience

Proven self-starter, good listener, highly-motivated, and team play

Excellent interpersonal and collaborative skills with the ability to influence business partners on proposed process optimizations
Meticulous attention to detail and strong communication skills
A high degree of business acumen and a positive, can-do attitude
Experience working cross-functionally
Desire to work in a fast-paced high-growth team environmen
Passionate about technology, continuous improvement, and end-user experience

The Utah System of Higher Education (USHE) is seeking a Security Analyst or depending on experience, a Senior Security Analyst to join our team. USHE is committed to providing accessible, affordable, and high quality post-secondary education to all Utah residents. Established in 1969, USHE is comprised of eight public colleges and universities, governed by the State Board of Regents and assisted by local Boards of Trustees. This position supports the Office of Commissioner of Higher Education, Utah Higher Education Assistance Authority, and my529 in downtown Salt Lake City.

If you have the passion, we have the career. Specifically, within the Information Security and Information Technology Departments, we pride ourselves on our camaraderie and teamwork; this is one of the biggest aspects of working here! If this sounds interesting, please read on and apply today.

Essential Functions:
Work under the guidance of the Information Security Officer in coordination with the Information Technology Department and other system support groups to execute USHE, UHEAA and my529 policies, procedures, and standards to ensure the security and privacy of information and information systems.
Analyze system vulnerability scans, penetration tests and risk assessments; and work with business units to resolve identified vulnerabilities within established SLAs.
Assist Information Security team in monitoring security systems, reviewing logs, managing information security systems.
Assist with managing various components of security operations.
Assist with elements of physical security, including access controls and surveillance systems.
Identify, report, and provide assistance during information security incidents as part of an Incident Response Team. Review and respond to security alerts to investigate malicious activity.
Participate in a 24x365 "On-Call" security team that supports the agency users and information systems.
Assist with internal and external information security assessments and reviews.
Assist in managing data loss prevention systems.
Assist in managing network and endpoint security systems.
Assist in managing web application firewalls.
Assist with analysis, maintenance, design and infrastructure.
Work closely with cross-functional teams and develop strong liaison relationships.
Keep current on technological trends and developments in the area of information security.
Position-Specific Characteristics:
Technical Aptitude Ability to comprehend complex technical topics and specialized information.
Systems Analysis Ability to determine how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and environment will affect outcomes.
Problem Solving Ability to find a solution for or to deal proactively with work-related problems.
Deductive Reasoning Ability to apply principals of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems.
Analytical Thinking - Ability to use thinking and reasoning to solve a problem.
Oral Communication - Ability to communicate effectively with others using the spoken word.
Work Under Pressure - Ability to complete assigned tasks under stressful situations.
Customer Oriented Ability to take care of the customers needs while following company procedures.
Organized - Possesses the trait of being organized or follows a systematic method of performing a task.
Knowledge:
Good understanding of security controls, monitoring systems, and business drivers that impact security policy and practices.
Knowledge of FISMA, NIST, PCI, and FERPA guidelines, as well as security best practices.
Excellent PC skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Understanding of operating system fundamentals and security aspects of operating systems.
Understanding of authentication systems (e.g., LDAP, SSH).
Exposure to common corporate technology platforms.
Experience with security information & event management (SIEM) systems.
Understanding of TCP/IP, networking fundamentals, and network security.
Knowledge of endpoint protection applications such as antivirus, anti-spyware, and file integrity monitoring technologies.
Experience managing firewalls and intrusion prevention systems (IPS).
Understanding of baseline security incident response procedures.
Programming or scripting experience desired. Experience scanning and reviewing code for security is helpful.
Experience monitoring the configuration of cloud services would be helpful SaaS, PaaS, IaaS.
Education:

Security Analyst: Bachelors degree and two years of relevant work experience preferred, or equivalent work experience may be considered. CISSP, GIAC, SSCP, or other security certification helpful.

Senior Security Analyst: Bachelors degree and four years of relevant work experience preferred, or equivalent work experience may be considered. CISSP, GIAC, SSCP, or other security certification helpful.

Experience:

This is a career-level position requiring two to four years of experience in the information security field.

Specific Requirements:
USHE/UHEAA does not sponsor work visas as an organization.
Position requires a 6c clearance level; due to our Federal Government Contract this position requires a current US Citizenship status and student loans cannot be in default status.
Benefits: This is how we say thank you to our employees. We offer
Health, Dental, Vision and Prescription Plans start on your first day of employment
Flexible Spending Accounts
Excellent retirement plans (At no cost to you, we invest 14.2% of your annual salary into a retirement plan!)
Tuition reduction (50%) at the University of Utah after 6 months
Tuition reimbursement after 90 days for business related courses (approved by HR)
Free Trax and Frontrunner passes
Free covered parking pass
Generous paid time off and sick leave
10 paid holidays
The Utah System of Higher Education is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Click here to view all USHE positions.

About This Role:
The Product and Supply Chain Manager drives innovation for FeedbackNow suite of hardware products, collects internal team ideas and external client suggestions, filters and prioritizes, evaluates and develops new solutions with partners, monitors projectsâ€™ progress, and tests and organizes product launch. The Product and Supply Chain Manager is responsible for securing and managing a cost-efficient and fast global supply chain for the FeedbackNow solution (all equipment including IoT devices and accessories). It includes inbound forecasting, procurement, quality control, inventory management, and all outbound shipping to clients and Forresterâ€™s entities.
FeedbackNow â€” as part of Forrester â€” is the leading provider of real-time feedback solutions, with large growth ambition. The innovative feedback systems made of hardware and software allow clients to implement lasting improvements to improve customer experience.

New product innovation:

Maintain purchasing related data in the company's ERP system.

Develop and implement effective negotiating strategies.

Clearwater Paper Corporation (NYSE: CLW) is a $1.7B company that manufactures quality consumer tissue, away-from-home tissue, parent roll tissue, and bleached paperboard and pulp at manufacturing and converting locations across the nation. Working at Clearwater Paper provides an opportunity to enrich your career through challenging and meaningful work and ongoing training and development—all in a supportive environment. We know our success depends on your success.

The Manufacturing Data Analyst supports our Consumer Product (Tissue) Division and is responsible for the preparation, analysis and validation of data compiled in the generation of diverse performance, costs, and financial metric reports. A member of the Mill Operations team and reporting into the Director of Manufacturing, this role works with five manufacturing facilities to manage multiple intenseness of Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) inclusive of identifying opportunities to improve our ERP System (JDEdwards). A key focus area for the role is to identify opportunities to improve consistency in the quality of performance and production data analytics derived from multiple systems.
Data Management & Reporting
Develop data quality rules inclusive of developing, measuring and implement data governance standards
Collaborate with IT to ensure data warehouse(s) performance supports SLA’s with division to ensure meeting manufacturing performance and productivity reporting cadence
Collaborate with business leaders to identify critical business performance metrics to develop and maintain a balanced performance scorecard
Perform data profiling tasks; analyzing key data in multiple systems in order to clarify structure content, relationships, and derivation of rules
Process Management
Develop procedural process guides to ensure data accuracy, yielding consistency in quality reporting
Evaluate existing suite of reporting tools and process; documenting and streamlining reporting processes
Implement routines to Extract/Load/Transform (ETL) data from various systems
Technical Continuous Improvement
Lead in collaboration with IT the design and documentation of key data processes; identify data owners and stewards
Partner with Manufacturing leaders to create ad-hoc queries; seeking to automate and standardize reporting
Proactively lead the identification of opportunities to develop and enhance analytical tools (Cost, Financial, Performance and Production)

Key Competencies & Attributes
Strong understanding of critical financial business metrics; ability to develop and leverage drive data to quantitative and analytical reporting to support business decisions
Able to think strategically and act tactically
Demonstrated ability to work in a matrixed and highly collaborative environment to influence change and core processes
High degree of business curiosity; quick learner with a proactive and agile mindset
Optimistically looks toward future for opportunities to innovate and improve
Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal); leading and presenting complex materials for various audiences
Change management skills; aligning and bringing others along
Required education and related experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Data Science, Analytics, Statics, Information Systems or related field required
Minimum of six years’ experience with data management, data integrity, data warehouse architecture and design
Minimum of six years’ experience with manufacturing BI reporting or related industry reporting
Experience with SQL Server, Master Data, JDE, MES
Skills and Abilities (technical/professional skills, expertise and qualifications):
Microsoft Certifications in Access, SQL Databases
Demonstrated commitment to ongoing personal development through continuing education, coaching and developing others
Highly adept performing at a fast pace communicating and collaborating across multiple stakeholders
Confident and proficient in navigating in an automated environment with proficiency in MS Office Suite, multiple business intelligence databases
Illustrative Functions:
Eye fatigue due to long hours of computer work
Office enviornment with occasional exposure to manufacturing enviornment
Less than 10% travel occasional business meetings
