job_title: Quality Data Analyst - Clinical Effectiveness - Full Time
job_description:
El Camino Health is committed to hiring, retaining and growing the best and brightest professionals who will carry our mission and vision forward. We are proud of our reputation in the community: One built on compassion, innovation, collaboration and delivering high-quality care. Come join the team that makes this happen.

FTE

1

Scheduled Bi-Weekly Hours

80

Work Shift

Day: 8 hours

Job Description

The Quality Data Analyst supports clinical business decisions and operational processes through interaction with executive management and other key management staff. In partnership with leadership and physician key stakeholders, the Quality Data Analyst identifies and supports areas of analytical focus for the organization's quality of service, care delivery performance and evaluation of potential areas of opportunity and risk. Incorporating clinical best practices and interpreted data, the analyst produces both long-term and short-term activities and deliverables and defines innovative solutions that drive measurable benefits to the organization. The Quality Data Analyst creates analytical tools using an in depth understanding of healthcare data (e.g. patient, claims, financial, clinical and provider data) and operations coupled with the knowledge of large data set development and quantitative data analysis methodology.

Responsibilities

The Analyst leads special projects, lending data expertise and actionable insight

Develops exception reporting and conduct drill down analysis to proactively identify specific variances in practice patterns

Generates customized work products, presentable for content and audience Maintains strong attention to details and prioritizes workload while meeting deliverables and expectations

Works autonomously and collaboratively with report requestors, providing guidance to define report requirements and validate results

Works collaboratively across departments to understand and meet the organization's clinical quality analytic needs

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in a healthcare-related field, science/social sciences, mathematics/statistics, information technology, or public/business administration

Five (5)years' experience in a managed care, hospital, provider practice or similar setting

Five (5) years' experience in data systems

Proficiency with SQL, Access, Excel, reporting software, Business Objects, Epic Clarity, Epic Reporting Workbench, PowerPoint and healthcare transactional systems

Experience building partnerships and fostering trust with cross functional team members

Experience working with databases, large data sets, multiple data sources and interpreting complex data to create meaningful information

Experience managing projects, tasks, deadlines and discerning priorities while working within budget constraints

Exhibits critical thinking and problem solving skills
Required/preferred EPIC certification(s) are: Cogito - Fundamentals, Caboodle Data Model/Fundamentals, Clarity Data Model/Fundamentals, Clinical Data Model, SQL I, SQL II

The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions of this job are available. El Camino Health will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with a disability if that will allow them to perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so creates an undue hardship for the hospital, or causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace which cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation.

Sedentary Work - Duties performed mostly while sitting; walking and standing at times. Occasionally lift or carry up to 10 lbs. Uses hands and fingers. - (Physical Requirements-United States of America)

An Equal Opportunity Employer:
El Camino Health seeks and values a diverse workforce. The organization is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of qualifications and competencies. El Camino Health prohibits discrimination in employment based on race, ancestry, national origin, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, marital status, age, medical condition or any other status protected by law. In addition to state and federal law, El Camino Health also follows all applicable fair and equitable employment policies from the County of Santa Clara.

Company: Herdt Consulting, Inc.

An excellent opportunity with a highly successful, Veteran-Owned Small Business (VOSB). Every day, our clients trust Herdt to help navigate their most complex business and organizational challenges. We partner with our clients at all levels to ensure all business objectives are fully realized. Herdt provides project management, process and leadership support as well as specialized technical support to the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) and other Federal agencies. Herdt employees are accomplished individuals who have served as hands-on leaders in the U.S. military and private industry - We hire the best. Our employees lead some of the most complex enterprise business systems and business processes through implementation and sustainment. We are valued for our technical knowledge, business process expertise and industry best-practice solutions. We take care of our people and pursue their successes.

Position Description:

Navy Logistic Experts who have a strong commitment to the Warfighter. The ideal candidate would have experience obtained as a former U.S. Navy Senior Logistics enlisted or Navy Supply Corp with tours on unit, afloat, and/or fleet support. The successful analyst will have a sound background in at least one of the following areas of Navy logistics: Afloat logistics, food service, ammunition, ship store, medical, general logistics or supply chain management. We plan to engage all specialties in afloat logistics. This person will be able to perform an analysis of the applicable supply chain and its life cycle of a product, to include the acquisition, distribution, allocation, and delivery. Additionally, s/he should have the ability to analyze the different functions of planning, implementation, and integration. Accomplished senior logistic professionals deserve this opportunity to make a difference in our Afloat Fleet Logistics Transformation.

Although the logistics management SME does not need to be an expert in all of these activities, s/he must understand the functional fields in logistical planning (requirements, capabilities, lead times, and costs) with enough depth to enable proper analysis of the information and procedures. Furthermore, the analyst should also have a broad knowledge of supply systems, procedures, programs and a strong commitment to deliver transformation that strengthens our Warfighters..



Roles and Responsibilities:
Provides operations support pertaining to logistical supply items
Performs analysis of materials and determines optimum control levels
Creates and maintains databases, reports and spreadsheets as required
Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
Understands technology from the â€œusersâ€ perspective in a logistics environment to search, order, maintain inventory, and deal with material handling
Able to be the voice of the customer, work with User Interface/User Experience (UI/UX) team to develop and present new functional interfaces that transforms the Navy
Supports testing as a user, understands the workflow and feel, and can constructively help the team improve the look and feel of the system to meet user acceptance requirements. Will not accept less than the best!
Must be a team player, work with others and get to mutually agreeable outcomes but not hesitant to represent the Fleet Warfighter.
Determines logistic support sequences and time phasing problems arising from location of operational area, and other factors, such as environmental and human factors affecting personnel. Deliver adaptive and transformative technologies to the deployed warfighter.
Highly Desired, But Not Required, Skills:
Afloat/Ashore Logistics Management; prioritizing multiple tasks to meet time critical requirements;
Coordinating with various functional areas to ensure timely receipt, testing, approval, packaging and documentation of inventory to meet fleet requirements.
May also include interpreting and evaluating demand history, analyzing end of life impacts on existing inventory, forecasting future demand based on fielding plans, researching and estimating cost trends for existing and future inventory, and providing recommendations to customers for inventory management updates.
The ability to exercise independent judgment while working on multiple projects of diverse scope will be key to successful performance of the task requirements associated with this position.
Experience in afloat automated supply/maintenance management systems and subject matter expertise in Alfoat Supply (all domains) Procedures is highly desired.
Experience/Education Requirements and Qualifications:
Minimum 10 years experience in Navy Logistics
Experience in a combination of Navy Afloat supply or maintenance logistics management.
Demonstrated experience in Navy Afloat Supply, logistics, inventory management, financial management, and the functionality of the integrated supply systems.

About U.Group
U.Group is an advanced technology and creative design company radically focused on using customer-centric innovation to create new opportunities in the public and private sectors. Working collaboratively out of offices in Arlington, VA, Washington, DC, Portland, OR, and in the heart of the action at client sites—U.Group delivers best-in-class digital services, powerful data platforms, augmented reality solutions, integrated marketing strategies, bundled services, and more. To learn more, visit www.U.Group.

Role Summary
As a Business Analyst at U.Group, you will be able to interface with a wide variety of departments and work on both large cross-functional projects and small system improvements. You will facilitate business process improvement by following user-centered and agile methods on projects in the public, private, and non-profit industry by working on cross-functional design and development teams. The results of your work will directly impact and improve the business of our customers and quality of life of their customers or users.
Citizenship Status: US Citizenship required and have resided in the U.S. for three of the past five years.
Location: Washington, DC | Arlington, VA | Portland, OR | Indianapolis, IN
Clearance: Current, or have the ability to obtain, public trust or higher security clearance

Minimum Qualification Requirements
This position is for one of our programs supporting the federal government. As part of the hiring process for programs like this, each candidate’s resume is evaluated against a strict set of requirements defined by the government client. For a candidate to be found “minimally qualified”, their resume must clearly illustrate all the requirements. For more information on preparing a federal resume, check out this GitHub Repo: https://github.com/rooneywp/govcon-hiring-guide/blob/master/resume_prep_guide.md
The minimum qualification requirements for this position are:
Shall have a minimum of three (3) years of experience focusing on business architecture analysis and UX/UI Design.
Shall have a minimum of one (1) year experience in building business process models, writing acceptance criteria, and designing user interfaces for a production system.
Key Objective #1: Create, maintain, and communicate user stories, business requirements documents, business analysis plans, and traceability matrices contribute to the successful delivery of a project team.
Conduct analysis and determine customer operational objectives by studying business functions, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats
Perform analysis on the feasibility of, and development requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems while ensuring the overall the system design fits the needs of the customer and end-users
Support a product’s vision and direction through comprehensive functional and technical analysis.
Define and improve customer systems by exploring current practices and designing modifications in a user-centered and agile method
Provide recommendations for improvements by actively identifying problems and communicating potential risks and solutions to the customer and project team
Assist with monitoring overall project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, creating progress reports, and recommendations
Maintain the protocols of the customer’s system by writing and updating procedures to inform the design and development of the overall system
Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; provides help desk support and training for users
Key Objective #2:Foster strong relationships with internal and customer stakeholders, user experience designers, developers, and project management to effectively lead and participate collaborative working sessions.
Facilitate or participate in collaborative working sessions with your peers and customer stakeholders
Contribute to overall team effort by working with fellow project team members in the completion of tasks
Participant in design reviews and technical demos to provide critique and feedback on the quality and performance of team work products
Key Objective #3: You will advocate for team members and facilitate the escalation and remove impediments.
Collaborate with fellow Business Analyst to mature and refine U.Group’s product development approach Providing mentoring and guidance to fellow Business Analysts as they progress in their professional development plan
Determine how core methods and processes should be matured to enhance the ability for U.Group to successfully deliver projects to its customers.


Life at U.Group
We encourage our colleagues to lead balanced lives. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability, wellness programs, flexible spending, 20 days paid time off, and paid holidays. We also offer:
Flex Time and Remote Work Options
Education reimbursement program
Fitness Reimbursement
Transit/parking subsidy program
Parental Leave Policy
Professional Development Program
401(k) with Company Match

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY – Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, we will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

U.Group shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR §§ 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals on the basis of protected veteran status or disability, and require affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

Supply Chain Analyst

Thank you for exploring a career with Plumbing Parts Group (PPG), a division of NCH Corporation. PPG is seeking a highly analytical Supply Chain Analyst. The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for analyzing the movement of goods through the supply pipeline, monitoring current processes, identifying and analyzing gaps, and developing process improvements. The Supply Chain Analyst is expected to use their skills in database administration and spreadsheet analysis to help the organization increase cash flows, inventory turns, customer satisfaction, and employee productivity. If youâ€™re seeking experience and growth in a personable, stable yet thriving environment, our Supply Chain Analyst role could be a match for you!

A little about us

Applying for a new job is a little like entering uncharted territory. We want you to feel 100% confident about the application process, the position and our company before committing your time to apply, so that none of the above comes as a surprise. Letâ€™s start with some information about PPG so you can get to know us better.

PPG Inc. houses two of the top brands in the plumbing business. Danco is one of the largest plumbing repair, replacement and remodeling suppliers in the home improvement industry. With over 40 years of experience, Danco focuses largely on empowering "Do-It-Yourselfâ€ consumers with plumbing solutions that are as practical, as they are affordable. LSP Products has provided a broad line of rough plumbing products sold mainly through the wholesale and OEM channels for over 40 years. LSP focused on designing and manufacturing innovative products to make a plumberâ€™s job simpler, easier and faster. Learn more at the companyâ€™s websites www.danco.com and www.lspproducts.com.

NCH Corporation is a privately held, family-owned, global business headquartered Irving, Texas, near Dallas. We have more than 7,500 employees, offices and facilities on six continents, and clients in more than 50 countries. This includes our corporate headquarters as well as subsidiary companies. We clean and conserve water, save energy, and deliver best-in-class maintenance solutions, with a focus on industrial and commercial businesses.

Culture and benefits

Weâ€™re a global company with a family feel, offering the same benefits of an international corporation with the personal relationships of a small business. Working in our small teams and close-knit environment, youâ€™d never guess we had a 7,500+ employee head count. We realize a job is more than just a job â€“ itâ€™s an extension of your life and family â€“ and weâ€™re committed to maintaining just that. For us, culture is not just a perk; itâ€™s essential to how we thrive. And thatâ€™s speaking for 100 years in the business!

Responsibilities:
Develop advanced financial, inventory, production forecasting and planning models that provide the supply chain team with information and analysis required to make optimal business decisions using advanced Excel, R/Python, PL/SQL, Oracle/ERP etc
Coordinate defined supply chain projects that target improved business practices and operational efficiencies to successful and timely completion
Define and implement appropriate supply chain metrics and reporting thru advanced Supply Chain Analytics (including material costs, purchase price variances, inventory levels, spend analysis, logistics costs) and recommend action plans to achieve improved results.

Work closely with other parts of the organization on critical business initiatives

Requirements:
Bachelor of Science with concentration in Industrial Engineering or Mechanical Engineering required (MS Supply Chain or Business Analytics preferred)
2-3 years of experience in supply chain environment.
Work experience analyzing global supply chain processes and delivering specific business value through data-driven insights
Strong quantitative and analytical skills; R/Python, PL/SQL, Oracle/ERP, advanced MS Excel
Familiar with logistics and production planning concepts (e.g., just-in-time, materials requirement planning)
Broad range of computer skillsâ€”database, statistics applications, and logistics software packages
Experience dealing with contracts and tariffs
Ability to communicate findings, make recommendations, and facilitate change
Project coordination skills

JOB TITLE

Demand Planner

MISSION - PURPOSE OF THE JOB

As a Demand Planner , you will play a key role in the Companyâ€™s Supply Chain organization. The Demand Planner will be responsible for forecasting customer orders impacting inventory levels and order fill rates.

POSITION OF THE JOB IN THE ORGANIZATION

Department: Supply Chain Management

Reporting to: Demand Planning Manager

LOCATION
Smithfield, RI

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Focus on key driving factors that influence supply chain performance metrics; such as inventory availability, forecast error, and customer order fill rates.
Produce weekly forecasts at the account sku level, which affect retail in-stock position and purchases with overseas suppliers.
Develop new item forecasting models based on account, product category, retail price points, and seasonality.
Revise initial forecasts based on early point-of-sale data collected from our major retailers.
Work closely with Supply Planners to achieve optimum in-stock position.
Develop a rapport with the Sales team to integrate demand drivers into forecasts including store counts, promotional activity, new style updates, phase out strategies, placement, pricing and internal revenue budgets.
Collaborate with accounts to incorporate retail inventory levels, EDI generated system orders, and open-to-buy into forecasts.
Perform regularly scheduled and ad-hoc analysis and reporting related to forecast performance metrics, inventory levels, and order fill rates.
TRANSVERSAL RESPONSIBILITIES
All employees have a responsibility to contribute to the Groupâ€™s sustainability and in doing so ensure that we can continue to fulfil our mission of improving lives by improving sight.
All business decisions and actions must serve and be in line with the Groupâ€™s sustainability goals and mission
PROFICIENCIES REQUIRED:
Ability to demonstrate outstanding analytical, financial acumen, planning and inventory control skills.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Working knowledge of distribution, sourcing, order processing, and supply chain principles.
Demonstrated ability to support and collaborate with internal teams (Sales, Merchandising, Supply Planning).
Proficient with MS-Office programs, primarily Excel.
Forecasting software experience a plus
Fluent English (both spoken and written), other language is a plus
Strong business partnering skills
Autonomous, with strong ability to work effectively in multi-cultural, geographically dispersed, virtual teams.
Influencing skills and project management experience in a matrix and complex organization, covering multi-region scope.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum of a Bachelorâ€™s degree required in a related discipline (material planning, supply chain, statistics, logistics).
2 years of professional experience in a related field.
ADDITIONAL COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:
Planning - Accurately scopes out length and difficulty of tasks and projects; sets objective and goals; breaks down work into the process steps; develops schedules and task/people assignments; anticipates and adjusts for problems and roadblocks; measures performance against goals; evaluates results.
Decision Quality - Makes good decisions based upon a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment; most of his/her solutions and suggestions turn out to be correct and accurate when judged over time; sought out by others for advice and solutions.
Business Acumen - Knows how businesses work; knowledgeable in current and possible future policies, practices, trends, and information affecting his/her business and organization; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace.
BEHAVIORS:
Ability to demonstrate, uphold, support, and model the Essilor Values:
Working Together
Innovation
Respect & Trust
Entrepreneurial Spirit
Diversity

Nearest Major Market: Providence
Nearest Secondary Market: Rhode Island

Responsibilities
Provides support and analytical insight for Quality Incentive measures, HEDIS measures, and Quality Improvement initiatives.

Job Description

To continue our digital transformation, we are looking for a strategic thinker and strong analytical mind to join the Data Analytics team that is tasked with implementing an enterprise strategy to enable seamless integration of analytics best practices and standards to business processes. The Sr. Data Analyst is a critical role to enabling stakeholders and partners to harness the power of their data for decision making. This role will be responsible to work directly with stakeholders, product managers, and engineering teams to understand business objectives/ goals. The Sr. Data Analyst will explore the data, ensuring quality and accuracy, and present it in easily consumable format for the business to use in their decision making process.

Objectives and Responsibilities

·Lead discussions with partner teams to elicit, define, and understand objectives, goals, and desired insights

·Provide subject matter expertise on the data needs for project deliveries, scope, acceptance, installation and deployment.

·Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports

·Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality

·Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems

·Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

·Filter and clean data to locate and correct code problems

·Work with management to prioritize business and information needs

·Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

·Work with data partners to develop/ enhance data to gain required insights

·Design and develop dashboards and reports to visualize analysis results using BI tools

·Contribute to the design, development and completion of project deliverables.

7+ years proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst

Knowledge of statistics and experience analyzing datasets

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

Must be comfortable working with large amounts of data

Ability to handle multiple tasks delivering under the Agile methodology

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future

10+ years proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst

RESERVIST APPOINTMENTS: The Reservist Program is an appointment type granted under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act, Section 306 (b), which authorizes FEMA to appoint such temporary employees as necessary to accomplish work authorized under the Act.
View common definitions of terms found in this announcement.

NOTE: If you are qualifying based on education and/or are selected for a position which requires a college degree to meet minimum qualification requirements, you will be required to submit your official college transcript(s) at time of selection.

When disaster strikes, America looks to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to support survivors and first responders in communities all across the United States of America and its territories. FEMA prepares the nation for all hazards and manages federal response and recovery efforts following any national incident. We foster innovation, reward performance and creativity, and provide challenges on a routine basis with a well-skilled, knowledgeable, high performance workforce. Please visit www.fema.gov for additional information.

Now FEMA looks to you, join our team and use your talent to support Americans in their times of greatest need. We are seeking talented individuals who are eager to assist disaster survivors on an intermittent, on-call basis. FEMA Reservists are incident management responders, hired under the Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. Reservists are a significant factor in the agency workforce in responding to disasters. These employees deploy to perform activities directly related to disasters, emergencies, projects, or activities of a non-continuous nature. Reservist positions are temporary appointments within the Excepted Service and are not to exceed 2 years in duration. Work opportunities are intermittent due to the irregular nature of disasters and Reservist employees are not guaranteed regular recurring hours, deployments, or renewal of employment. Apply for this exciting opportunity to become a FEMA Reservist!

EMERGENCY ASSIGNMENT: Every FEMA employee has regular and recurring emergency management responsibilities, though not every position requires routine deployment to disaster sites. All positions are subject to recall around the clock for emergency management operations, which may require irregular work hours, work at locations other than the official duty station, and may include duties other than those specified in the employee's official position description. Travel requirements in support of emergency operations may be extensive in nature (weeks to months), with little advance notice, and may require employees to relocate to emergency sites with physically austere and operationally challenging conditions.

As a Supply Management Specialist (Logistics Specialist) in FEMA's Reservist Program, you will serve as the subject matter expert in logistics operations. Typical duties include:
Moving and transporting goods to include the loading and unloading of goods off trucks.
Reconciling items such as; bill of lading, shipping documents, inventory lists, and property transfer reports.
Setting up and breaking down office spaces and furniture while assisting with the maintenance of a facility.
Maintaining supply room by securing high-value items and conducting inventories.
Receiving, inspecting and distributing equipment and other materials to proper recipients while maintaining accountability.
Providing mail service and establishing a centralized mail distribution and pickup center.
To qualify for the Reservist Supply Management Specialist (Logistics Specialist) position, you must possess work experience in each of the following areas:
Managing accountable property to include; shipping, receiving, loading, unloading, storing, distributing and conducting inventory of large volume and high-value supplies, equipment, or commodities.
Utilizing computer systems, databases, spreadsheets or mobile devices to record, track, analyze and report data on accountable property.
OR

A master's or equivalent graduate degree

or

2 full years of progressively higher-level graduate education leading to such a degree

or

LL.B. or J.D., if related

IN ADDITION:
Minimum age of eighteen years of age is required.
All candidates must be a high school graduate or possess a GED.
Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g. Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills, and provides valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Your application must show that you meet all requirements for this position. You may be found"not qualified" if you do not possess the minimum competencies required for the position.

NOTE: Qualifications are based on breadth/level of experience. In addition to describing duties performed, applicants must provide the exact dates of each period of employment (from MM/YY to MM/YY) and the number of hours worked per week if part time. As qualification determinations cannot be made when resumes do not include the required information, failure to provide this information may result in disqualification. Applicants are encouraged to use the USAJOBS Resume Builder to develop their federal resume. For a brief video on How to Create a Federal Resume, click here.

Current or former FEMA Reservists/DAE employees: To accurately credit your experience for these intermittent positions, make sure to list the dates (from MM/YY to MM/YY) of each deployment, along with the job title and specific duties you were responsible for during each deployment. Failure to provide this information may result in disqualification.

KIPP New Jersey & Miami seeks a full-time Data Systems Analyst to support students, families, teachers and school operations as we double in size to serve over 15,000 students in the next 5 years. This is an exciting and fast-paced role that will drive how data is utilized across critical systems and processes to support more than 20 schools. In this role, the Data Systems Analyst will be responsible for a wide range of responsibilities across student, staff and operational data systems while learning and applying high-demand skills.

Must haves:
Ability to quickly learn the basics of unfamiliar specialized systems and software platforms
Ability to approach challenges as a systems thinker: a determined problem-solver with ability to create and innovate scalable solutions on the go, sometimes with limited time and resources
Experience using spreadsheets to analyze data and improve data management
Familiarity with core Google Apps, including: Sheets, Slides, Docs, and Drive
Collaborative working style with a strong drive to learn and share knowledge
Highly self-motivated and directed, with excellent attention to detail
Excellent communicator with the ability to explain complex, technical ideas to a non-technical audience
Ability to use quantitative methods for research and problem solving
Nice to have:
Experience working in schools/K-12 education (highly preferred)
Experience with any of our core systems such as PowerSchool, DeansList, Clever, Illuminate, Whetstone or SurveyGizmo
Experience with Tableau (or other data visualization tools) or SQL (or other languages such as Python, BigQuery, etc)
Experience with project management support and software such as Asana or Zendesk
Understanding of the structure of relational databases
Here’s what you’ll be doing:
Manage, maintain and optimize our core student and staff information systems to ensure daily operations are running efficiently across PowerSchool, DeansList, Illuminate, Clever, SurveyGizmo, Whetstone, among others
Support and coordinate troubleshooting for school leaders, teachers and staff across data systems, applications and reporting requests
Develop and execute high-quality trainings to drive adoption of new technology, applications or protocols that improve how staff utilize and manage data
Perform ad-hoc analyses and develop reports across student, staff and compliance projects
Write documentation for systems, processes, and data tools
Coordinate project design and implementations between Data, Teaching and Learning, Technology, School Ops and Leadership teams
Lead coordination between regional student information point people and central Data team
Support various staff performance management systems
Learn new software, how to build dashboards using Tableau and query data from a SQL data warehouse
Compensation & Benefits
In addition to a competitive salary, KIPP NJ offers a full comprehensive benefits plan, including health care, retirement, an optional subsidized wireless plan through Verizon, a laptop and transportation benefits for TEAMmates commuting into New Jersey from the New York City area.

About KIPP New Jersey
KIPP New Jersey schools are part of the nationally recognized “Knowledge Is Power Program” non-profit network of college-preparatory, public charter schools educating elementary, middle, and high school students. In 2002, KIPP New Jersey first opened its doors in Newark’s South Ward as a single class of 80 fifth graders and has since grown to teach over 5,100 students in grades K-12 in Newark and Camden. 92% of KIPP New Jersey students currently qualify for free or reduced-price meals. Today, we have grown to 16 (K-12) schools throughout Newark and Camden, NJ and Miami, FL. Learn more about KIPP here.

KIPP New Jersey/Miami is an equal opportunity employer.

PURPOSE:
The Enterprise Portfolio Management Office (EPMO) is seeking an efficient, detail-oriented research analyst to join our growing organization. In this position, you will interpret, manage, and analyze organizational data in order to translate results into better solutions. You will be working with various source data systems and will be required to pull that data together, conduct validation and sanity checks, look for discrepancies, and organize the data in a way that permits effective analysis. Once the data is organized, the position will be required to investigate data trends and findings, leading to the development of visualizations and recommendations. The position will be tasked to work with information such as resource allocation and utilization data, project scheduling data, burn rates and other Agile metrics, defect metrics, and other associated project/program/portfolio information.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Under the direction of the Manager, FEPOC Portfolio Management Office, the principle duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Duties and Responsibilities

Process Management

• Compliance
o Supports compliance of the standard PMO processes and ensures adherence to them.
o Understands and facilitates adherence to processes supporting PMO services.
• Stewardship
o Executes existing processes as written and provides feedback on potential opportunities for improvement
o Supports stewardship of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) by soliciting feedback from users and mentoring on how to follow the procedures.


Portfolio Management

• Oversight
o Supports oversight of the FEPOC PMO portfolio.
o Supports collection of portfolio metrics and preparation of reports and analyses
o Facilitates FEPOC PMO portfolio oversight activities to monitor and control portfolio performance.
• Strategy
o Awareness of corporate strategy.
• Reporting
o Assembles and validates pre-defined reports
o Provides verbal presentations of report content
o Designs and prepares simple reports
o Develops graphs and charts as appropriate to support reporting, including metrics, trends, anomalies, etc. represent very detailed data at a summary level.
o Supports and implements presentation formats and scenarios to help convey information to executives.
• Tools
o Maintains high quality of information within the PPM tool.

Data Analysis, Reporting, and Presentation

• Analysis
o Performs standard data analysis, draws conclusions, and makes recommendations for risk mitigation. Data includes: Schedule, Resource, Milestone, Issues, Risks, Dependencies, and Financials.
• Facilitation
o Contributes in portfolio review meetings, including capture of meeting minutes and tracking of action items to resolution
• Financial Management
o Supports project financial reporting at the portfolio level and contributes to the analysis and escalation
• Resource Management
o Supports preparation of resource management reporting and contributes to the analysis and escalation
• Schedule Management
o Supports management of PMO enterprise schedule/calendar.
o Supports milestone-level integrated schedule oversight.
o Understands project work breakdown structures and supports portfolio-level schedule management.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Required:

- BS Degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science, Project Management, or Management Information Systems or directly related equivalent experience
- 0 to 2+ years relevant experience in roles requiring project/portfolio management, resource & risk analysis, financial project management and metrics reporting.
- Familiarity with Project Portfolio Management tools (e.g. CA Clarity PPM, HP PPM, Planview PPM, etc.)
- Familiarity with Enterprise Reporting tools (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, etc.)
- Beginner or higher proficiency with MS Project, PowerPoint, SharePoint, InfoPath
- Intermediate or higher proficiency with MS Excel

Accountability
- Strong sense of accountability
- Takes initiative
- Requires supervision
Analytical
- Strong analytical skills; passion for understanding data; curiosity, thirst for knowledge; desire to investigate root causes of data patterns and trends.
- Able to identify relevant data points to analyze
Aptitude
- Quick learner; can easily learn new business and technical tools and processes.
Communications
- The ability to communicate clearly and effectively; must be able to clearly articulate complex data.
- Strong verbal and written communication skills – able to communicate very detailed information at a summary level.
- Excellent oral and written communications; an ability to present and discuss technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding.
Flexibility
- Effective in a highly dynamic environment; able to handle changing priorities.
Interpersonal
- Ability to build collaborative and trusting relationships with peers and all levels of management
- Solid teamwork and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate and persuade customers, employees, and management at all levels and thrive in a cross-functional environment.
Leadership

Organizational
- Solid organizational skills; ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously.
Process Discipline

- Strong technical skills, with ability to build and maintain tools for process automation, data integrity/validation, reporting and executive presentations as well as ability to leverage tools for hands-on data analysis.

Launched in 2007, CenTrak is a leader in Real-Time Location Systems (RTLS) for the healthcare market. We strive to ensure the right technology is available at the right time to save lives and manage healthcare costs. Our culture is fueled by innovation. CenTrak has been recognized in Deloitteâ€™s Tech Fast 500 for three consecutive years as one of the fastest growing tech companies and the top Real Time Location Systems (RTLS) provider in North America, leading the industry with the most enterprise-wide installations. CenTrak can be found in over 900 healthcare installations worldwide including 30+ of Beckerâ€™s Top 100 Greatest Hospitals in America.
CenTrak improves healthcare operational workflow and the quality of patient care via the industry's most robust and scalable Enterprise Location Servicesâ„¢. CenTrak currently locates millions of patients, staff, visitors and assets in healthcare facilities all over the world. The company is best known for its Second-Generation Infrared (Gen2IRâ„¢) technology which delivers Clinical Grade Locating, a requirement for workflow and other key healthcare automation opportunities.

The group has nearly 50 businesses operating through two sectors (Medical & Environmental) in more than 20 countries and major operations in Europe, North and South America and Asia, supplying customers in 160 countries and employing more than 5,800 people worldwide.

About Raycon

Raycon is one of the fastest-growing D2C brands, dedicated to shaking up the consumer electronics industry. Co-founded by entertainer/entrepreneur Ray J, we're inspired by the go-getters, the early risers, the performers and one-more-milers of the world. That's why we're dedicated to creating high-quality wireless audio products that fit the wants and needs of all kinds of doers out there, without the mark-up or false hype.

Our products have been featured with high profile celebrities such as P. Diddy, Justin Bieber, Snoop Dogg, Cardi B, Ne-Yo, Migos, Cara DeLevingne and many more. We've also been featured in and garnered press from media outlets such as Forbes, CNN, Mashable, Cheddar, and Billboard.

We have experienced rapid growth over the past year and are looking for fellow self-starters and go-getters to join our team. Learn more about us at buyraycon.com

About the Role

Raycon is looking to bolster our marketing team with a highly skilled and business-savvy Digital Marketing Specialist. This is an amazing opportunity for someone looking to grow with a quickly growing and successful startup brand.

Marketing acts as the forefront of our team. The successful candidate will allow us to constantly push the boundaries of growth based on the insights collected from our past performance and help identify new opportunities for growth as we proceed. As the brand's primary digital analyst, you will be a fundamental player in analyzing key business data and supporting important marketing decisions.

This is a full-time position Monday through Friday, and will require you to be on-site at our New York office following the easing of stay-at-home restrictions in New York City. At Raycon, we look for you to hit the ground running from day one.

What You'll Do
Analyze the impact and ROI of acquisition and retargeting campaigns across digital and non-digital marketing channels
Monitor sitewide metrics, such as conversion rate, bounce rate, and lifetime value
Develop and maintain dashboards to monitor the brand's financial and sales performance
Provide reporting related to marketing performance KPIs, media results, and promotional campaigns
Produce actionable insight that will improve and optimize ongoing marketing strategies
Who You Are
You're like us! You're a self-starter, a go-getter, and get-it-doner. You thrive in fast-paced environments and like getting your hands dirty.

About us


Life360 brings families closer with smart tools designed to protect and connect the people who matter most.

Known for first-to-market solutions for modern family challenges, Life360 recently reached #1 in Apple's US App Store's list of free social networking apps. Nearly 1 in 10 US families with kids use Life360 an average of 12 times a day, and global membership is growing exponentially, with over 25 million monthly active users in over 140 countries making Life360 the largest mobile service for families in the world.

This reach gives us the opportunity to do unprecedented good for families through our valued core offerings: advanced location sharing, private messaging, driver monitoring, help alerts, 24/7 roadside assistance, and Crash Detection with emergency response. On average we respond to 1,000 roadside assists and dispatch 200+ ambulances each month to those in need.

Offering both free and paid memberships. In addition, the company has raised over $200 million in equity financing, and recently completed an IPO on the ASX exchange giving our employees the liquidity of a public company with the upside of a private growth stage business.

Life360's rapidly growing team of 150+ employees is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Diego, and Las Vegas.

About the Job


Data plays a crucial role in Life360's growth by driving smarter decisions, improving operations, and creating higher value user experiences. As an analytics team, we partner with a wide variety of cross-functional partners to apply data insights against strategic initiatives. "Know Our Users" is a Life360 core value and we're looking for analytics professionals who are passionate about leveraging user data to create value for Life360 families.

You'll be working in a dynamic growth environment, leading efforts to better understand the business, the product, and the customer. Life360 has one of the most interesting datasets in the world: location, driving, product usage, and purchasing behavioral data - all centered around who matters most, the family. If you have a passion for making an impact and working on products that help millions of families around the world, then this is the right place for you.

Responsibilities


Analytics team members work closely with specific strategic teams but also have opportunities to work on company-wide initiatives. This person is expected to focus on that particular area but also generalize their skills towards other parts of the business with a variety of projects.

In this role, we are looking for someone to partner with the Revenue team in developing actionable insights from both product and financial perspectives. Common projects range from financial disclosure reports that tell Life360's growth story to conducting deep-dive analyses into identifying opportunities for subscription growth. Ultimately, you will be tasked with finding data insights that deliver business value.

These are some typical responsibilities:
Leverage data to understand the Life360 family and their product usage, developing insights that apply to product, marketing, and business strategy.
Partner with executives, product managers, engineers, marketers, designers to translate data insights into smarter decisions and applications.
Establish and manage KPIs that measure the health of the business, product performance, and customer experience quality.
Build dashboards and reporting processes to monitor business and product trends.
Develop frameworks, tools, and best practices to apply data insights towards business questions.
Conduct analyses and build models that identify opportunities and drive growth.
Design and analyze experiments, communicate results, and drive decisions.
Potential projects may include forecasting business performance, developing family driving profiles, and predicting customer lifetime value.
Qualifications


We are looking for candidates with a diverse background that will compliment the skills and backgrounds of the current team. If you don't fit all the criteria below please apply anyway as this list is more of a preference rather than a rule. Our priority is for a well rounded team that delivers results.
We are looking for candidates who have had previous experience on analytics teams and are willing to help coach and mentor colleagues on best data practices.
5+ years is preferred.
Degree in a quantitative field like statistics, economics, applied math, operations research, or engineering, finance, business intelligence. Advanced degrees are preferred.
Experience in product analytics related to mobile apps
SQL expertise - able to write structured and efficient queries on large datasets.
Experience in scripting languages, like analysis and visualization libraries in Python or R.
Strong verbal/written communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners to build the business.
Proficiency in building data visualizations and interactive dashboards with tools like Tableau.
Experience designing and evaluating experiments to draw inferential recommendations.
Curiosity to learn about new topics and uncover hidden insights.
Perks
Fridays are Work From Home days at Life360
Competitive pay and benefits
Free snacks, drinks (three ways to brew your favorite cup of coffee), and food in the office
Catered lunches throughout the week
Health, dental and vision insurance plans
401k plan
$200/month Quality of Life perk
A great office with plenty of light in the heart of the SOMA district in beautiful San Francisco
Whatever makes you stronger makes us stronger. We buy you the things you need to improve yourself and get your job done.

Associate, Benchmarking Analyst

LogicSource Overview

LogicSource is an innovative leader in sourcing and procurement services, we help companies increase profits through better buying. LogicSource® is owned and operated by an experienced group of global business veterans who came together under the common goal to radically change the way sourcing and procurement works. We’ve reinvented sourcing and procurement with an execution-based, fully transparent business model that ensures clients don’t spend a dime until they see results.

Our people gain exposure to projects and clients spanning a broad set of categories across multiple industries. Opportunities for getting involved, whether working across functions or learning a new category abound.

Our business model reflects our culture – radically different and rife with opportunity to make a difference. Our professionals enjoy the intellectual stimulation, challenge and satisfaction that only a sophisticated organization, coupled with relevant and meaningful business challenges to solve, can afford.

Position Summary:

We have an immediate opening for a full-time Analyst in our Norwalk, CT headquarters. You will be a key member of our analytics team, reporting to the Managing Director, Business Analytics.

Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for managing multiple clients’ historic and current purchasing data in order to forecast and report spend and savings. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Collaborating with client and internal stakeholders to identify and secure relevant data for analysis
Interpreting and classifying complex purchasing data in order to understand clients’ historic and current services, specifications, and costs
Identifying, securing, and assessing data in a variety of formats and from a variety of sources
Analyzing data, evaluating costs, and providing analysis throughout the solutions and transition phases of client engagements
Analyzing vendor pricing and RFx results and preparing analysis to support sourcing and procurement decisions
Measuring savings and identifying economies by comparing RFx pricing with client baseline data
Preparing reports of findings for presentations to client and internal stakeholders
Utilizing savings models and building scenarios in support of solution development
Refining data management systems and reporting processes to deliver accurate and quality insights for ongoing decision-making
Required Education and Experience:
Bachelors Degree required
Experience managing and analyzing large quantities of data
Knowledge of data cleansing and formatting methods and techniques
Advanced proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, v-look-ups)
Prior experience with databases and business intelligence reporting tools is a plus
Ability to quickly learn and apply new software
Strong problem solving skills
Ability to produce quality materials within tight timeframes and manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing accordingly to meet deadlines
Ability to work effectively as part of a diverse cross-functional team
Excellent organizational skills; strong attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills

Reporting to the Manager of the Workforce Planning and Management (WPM) Analytics and Insights team, the WPM Data Analyst will play a vital role in enhancing the analytical functions within the WPM department. This position's primary focus will be to develop solutions in the areas of data analytics, forecasting, visualization, and automation. Maintaining and developing these solutions will aid in improving WPM's ability to manage capacity and resources for the respective business units it supports. The individual will not only leverage their technical and analytical experience to support the team, but also use their experiences working within teams to facilitate proactive and timely communication.

Analytics, Modeling & Forecasting

The primary objective of this role will be to unlock new insights and produce accurate forecasts by leveraging statistical analyses and machine learning techniques. The analyst will start by understanding and evaluating WPM’s current forecasting and modeling capability. The analyst will then develop and deploy new models that enable WPM to effectively manage the capacity and demands of its key stakeholders. The analyst will also spend time performing various ad hoc analyses to deliver insights to WPM stakeholders as opportunities occur.

Visualizations & Business Unit Communication

This position will have a strategic role in developing new visualizations that will increase transparency and provide new business insights pertaining to capacity management. This position will be responsible for developing new dashboards and KPIs that report on historical, current and forecasted performance, including business metrics and model forecasts. The individual will also actively work with their WPM peers to communicate business line performance to WPM’s business partners.

Data Management & Architecture

This role will play a supporting role in centralizing and stream-lining the flow of data from the various systems and databases WPM uses to support the business. Improving the data storage capabilities within WPM will provide the necessary foundation to improve the other analytical, forecasting and reporting functions the individual will need to support. The individual will aid in efforts to:
Identify all current sources of data and any new sources of data worth utilizing
Centralize all data into a single source and remove the dependency on MS Office based systems
Identify and develop new data tables and metrics to support analytics, forecasts and visualizations
Automation & Lean Initiatives

This position will play a supporting role in finding new ways to increase the team’s efficiency in executing its day to day tasks and deliverables. The individual will help identify and implement automation opportunities, as well as implement strategic lean practices that improve the team’s productivity. Additionally, the position will help the WPM department prioritize and implement automated solutions where necessary.

Required
College degree and 3+ years’ experience in Data Science, Operations Management, Operations Research, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems or related degrees and fields
Knowledge of advanced statistical concepts to provide new insights to internal and external stakeholders
Proficiency with data, particularly querying data with SQL and managing data in spreadsheets or databases
Experience developing optimization models, time-series models, simulations and machine learning solutions
Experience using object-oriented programming languages like Python to develop models, perform analytical tasks and to automate processes
Strong analytical foundation, sound judgment, and ability to solve problems independently
Demonstrated ability to leverage technology to implement efficient, robust and cross-functional solutions
Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and resolve data-related technical issues
Experience with visualization software like Tableau, Spotfire or BI to communicate business performance and status
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks
Proven ability to persuade peers, inspire associates, clients and vendors to comply with current policies and procedures
Preferred

· Demonstrated proficiency creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics like regressions, simulations, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, and neural networks

· Experience using tools, like Atlassian, that foster collaboration, development, and version control for programming solutions

· Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and their ecosystem of solutions like EC2, RDS and Redshift

· Knowledge on how to leverage tools like Hadoop and Spark to implement big data solutions

· Experience leveraging data from 3rd party providers like Google Analytics

· Demonstrated leadership skills and experience

· Excellent customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills

Thornburg Investment Management is a privately owned global investment firm offering a range of solutions for investors around the world. Founded in 1982 and headquartered in Santa Fe, NM, we manage U.S. mutual funds, separate accounts for high-net-worth investors and institutional accounts, and UCITS funds for non-U.S. investors.

At Thornburg, it’s more than what we do; it’s how we do it. A flexible perspective built on collaboration and cross-pollination of ideas, an unconventional approach to portfolio construction, and a reputation of integrity are important aspects of how we do business. Far from the groupthink of Wall Street, Thornburg is positioned to offer a different point of view and a broader frame of reference in our global search for relative value opportunities.

The successful candidate will collaborate with the global fixed income portfolio management team while performing fundamental security level research and portfolio analysis within the global fixed income landscape. This position will support the current portfolio offerings as well as the growth and development of future credit opportunities with a focus alternative offerings.The emphasis of this role initially will be broad based corporate credit (IG, HY, converts, loans). While each member of the team operates with a degree of specialization, each member is also expected to explore and express ideas across multiple fixed income sectors (corporate credit, structured products, rates, etc.). Thornburg’s unique collaborative team approach requires all members to think and act like portfolio managers very early in their careers and each member’s input is important in our portfolio construction process.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Analyze individual securities for inclusion in Thornburg portfolios. Create and maintain models and in-depth research notes leveraging skills in accounting, finance and economics
Monitor securities and portfolios on a daily basis to help grow and foster a ‘portfolio manager’ level of thinking and relative value framework
Serve in a global generalist capacity, whereby coverage and responsibilities span geographies, industries and asset classes (corporate, structured product, MBS, rates, etc.). Candidates will be expected to develop an improved understanding of markets and sectors across time.

MINIMUM EXPERIENCE AND FORMAL REQUIREMENTS:

- Differentiating credit experience preferred (e.g. EM local currency debt, credit shorting, CLOs, venture debt & private credit, structured equity)

- Investment industry experience required

- Knowledge of accounting, finance, and portfolio theory necessary

- Progress toward MBA/CFA preferred

- Passion for financial markets
Strong analytical and communication skills
Proactive and creative thinking
Collaborative, flexible, ethical, humble self-starter

- Candidate must have or be able to obtain work authorization in the US

JDRF is the leading global organization focused on type 1 diabetes (T1D) research. JDRF’s goal is to progressively remove the impact of T1D from people’s lives until we achieve a world without T1D. About the Position

The Business Intelligence Analyst is a mid-level role within the Business Intelligence job family, working closely with our business and technical teams under direction of the manager to deliver BI solutions to our customers. This is a client facing and internal role that is responsible for documentation, development and quality analysis including all matters regarding our Analytics portfolio.

The BI Analyst can operate independently within the practice, supporting larger BI requests in complexity and scope, including client escalations. They can articulately and concisely explain the implications of complex data sets and various analytics solutions to customers. They regularly will be executing on parallel projects, and work closely with other BI peers to maintain established practice cycle times and mentoring junior members of the team. They may be required at times to analyze the CareLogic database for creative solutions, or to better understand the business use of the data being entered. They must be able to understand the nuances of reporting and BI needs of the behavioral health market in order to help prioritize work and recommend viable solutions to business and technical teams.

Please note that we will not sponsor visas for this position.

Description
Who We Are

Telaid, a provider of technology deployment solutions to multi-site companies for more than 37 years, seeks an experienced Procurement Analyst who is looking for an opportunity to join a team in a growing, privately held Company. If you are an experienced Procurement Analyst who is skilled at coordinating the accurate and timely delivery of equipment and materials required to execute tasks on a client site then Telaid has a great opportunity to share with you.

Our Core Values are:
Be Proactive
Be A Team Player
Take Ownership
Do The Right Thing
Who You Are

Youâ€™ll be a professional eager to support the administrative function of the Procurement team. Youâ€™ll work directly in support of the Procurement Manager and function as the single point of contact (SPOC) for the project team on specific accounts. Your primary responsibility is coordinating the accurate and timely delivery of equipment and materials required to execute tasks on a client site. Successful execution of tasks directly impacts the overall delivery of a rollout or construction project.

Location
Niantic, CT (no relocations, please)
Why This Role Matters

The organization is growing and the need for employees who embody our core values is essential for our continued success. The Procurement Analyst provides critical services to the PMO team, and as such it requires attention to detail, telephone and customer service skills, data entry skills and proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel, and Telaid systems such as ServiceNow and Accpac.

Who Your Customers Are

The Procurement Analyst works closely with the Procurement Manager, Project Managers and other project stakeholders during the planning, kickoff & execution phase of projects. They have responsibility to execute the plan and monitor/control material delivery to ensure that materials and/or equipment are available when needed for onsite execution.

Primary Responsibilities
Generally focused on internal project administrative support within ServiceNow and Accpac.
RP open balances for all completed purchase orders. Ensure that all closed ServiceNow Tasks are priority for RP process
Create purchase orders in ServiceNow as directed by Procurement Manager
Update ServiceNow cases as directed by Program Manager / PM
Create and submit Purchase Orders (POs) and Receipts (RPs) in Accpac for invoicing; provide backup as necessary to meet client requirements
Interface with Project Team, Field Technicians and vendors
Coordinates timely material and equipment delivery
Tracks shipments and provide timely updates to stakeholders
Validates vendor pricing in support of Engineering
Must be flexible and able to work on tasks that change frequently or are assigned daily
Coordinate with Engineering and Estimating team to validate and update annual estimators
Other duties as assigned by Procurement Manager or superior.
Identifies additional sources of materials/equipment in the event of back orders
Organization
Ensure that account activities operate within policies and procedures.
Ensure that account activities comply with corporate and client standards.
Supports and contributes to the development of workflows that engender trust, accurate information and timely communication
Develop forms and records to document account activities
Oversee the case management procedures and maintenance of records; enabling accurate invoicing
Submit vendor requirements to maximize incentive programs
Controlling
Provide status and reporting on accounts activities to stakeholders
Communicate with management on account rollouts and large projects
Ensure that vendors honor published pricing and upholds approved budget
Ensure that all ServiceNow records for the account are up to date.
Ensure that timely receipts (RP) are generated and submitted to Finance Team; according to the established timelines and best practices.
Identify and evaluate the risks associated with vendor activities and take appropriate action to escalate those findings
Qualifications
Work Experience & Education
Must process a High School Diploma or equivalent. (Associates Degree is preferred)
Experience in one of more of the following areas: LAN/WAN Data/Voice Infrastructure, Wifi WLAN, CCTV, Intrusion, Fire/Life Safety, BISCI standards, CommScope, Belden, Panduit, ServiceNow, and others.

Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from individuals at all levels.
Ability to read, analyze and interpret various technical business data.
strong computer literacy with Microsoft Office suite.
Potential Career Path

Telaid supports and fosters promotions from within. The career path for this position may include Procurement Analyst Lead, Procurement Manager, or additional leadership positions beyond the department should these positions be an interest or fit.

Learning and Development Opportunities

Many development and learning opportunities will be provided once we start to see opportunities for growth and refinement of your existing skill set.

ESI provides direct support to Leidos Biomedical Research, Inc. (Leidos Biomed) in its support of the National Cancer Institute (NCI) and its mission to accelerate the prevention and treatment of cancer. Leidos Biomed's support of NCI includes the management and execution of projects sponsored by the NCI Center for Biomedical Informatics and Information Technology (CBIIT).
ESI has an opening for an IT Project Manager to support the development of the data strategy for the ATOM initiative.. The Accelerating Therapeutics for Opportunities in Medicine (ATOM) Consortium, formed by a public-private Cooperative Research and Development Agreement among GlaxoSmithKline (GSK), Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL, for DOE), Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research (FNLCR, for NCI), and University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), aims to integrate the unique capabilities of high performance computing, new approaches to characterize cancer biology, and preclinical data access to implement new computational tools and technologies, validated empirically, to impact current drug discovery paradigms. The success of ATOM has the potential to fundamentally transform the treatment landscape for cancer, build a modern drug discovery platform for other diseases, and create the technology and computing infrastructure to enable the precision medicine era.
ATOM’s goal of evolving the cancer drug discovery process from an iterative, sequential make and test cycle to a network of in silico and high content experimental protocols designed by predictive simulation, deep learning, and high-performance analytics will require oncology and data science expertise, as well as technology development from a range of disciplines and domain areas. The workflow of ATOM is expected to require contributions from multiple scientific disciplines including computational technologies (e.g. supercomputing, machine/deep learning, active learning), multi-scale modeling (e.g. human pharmacokinetics, protein models, cell/tumor models), and experimental systems (e.g. advanced, ex vivo biological/organoid models). These wide-ranging domains are expected to yield a highly collaborative, trans-disciplinary research environment where scientists with diverse expertise can interact and share research, knowledge, and data.
KEY ROLES/RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate and coordinate with a diverse set of project stakeholders, including Leidos, consortium participants and other subject matter experts
Leverage technical expertise to benefit the project and client interactions
Provide logistical support through scheduling, facilitation, and participation in meetings to support collaborative activities with the NCI, Leidos and consortium participants
Lead development of monthly and ad hoc technical status reports to management, the NCI and other project stakeholders
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge of public, licensed and private data sources employed in pharmaceutical development
Familiarity with Pharmacokinetics (PK) and toxicity models and data employed for pharmaceutical development
Familiarity with consortia (public and private) supporting pharmaceutical development
Knowledge of data management processes
Knowledge of data curation process for preparing datasets
Possession of a master's degree in a quantitative or technology discipline from an accredited college or university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation. Foreign degrees must be evaluated for U.S. equivalency
In addition to the education requirements, a minimum eight (8) years of progressively responsible job-related experience
Must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Possession of a PhD in Computer Science, Math or Biomedical Science related field from
an accredited college or university. Foreign degrees must be evaluated for U.S.
equivalency.
Familiarity with use of artificial intelligence and high performance computing in pharmaceutical development
Expected Competencies:
Must be detail-oriented and possess strong organizational and analytical skills with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks/projects
Ability to work with ease in a fast paced, agile environment
Self-motivated and result-oriented, able to handle multiple projects efficiently
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Must be a team player

Business Analyst

Job Location: Boston, MA

Join our team

Centric Consulting is not the typical consulting company. We live our core values and bring them with us in all we do for our clients and community. Our core purpose is simple: every day we strive to provide unmatched customer and employee experiences and foster a culture of respect, diversity, and transparency. It’s this culture, our people, and delivery that come together to make Centric a trusted advisor to local businesses.

Our Boston business unit is a draw for Fortune 500 companies, long time family-run companies, and start-ups alike. Our clients know that we are honest, transparent and deliver on our commitments. We have built our team with people who embrace the freedom and responsibility our model depends upon. We’re looking for a Business Analyst to join our growing team.

In this role, you will:
Work with business stakeholders to gather and document business needs and translate them into operational requirements.
Ability to translate business vision into defined and prioritized stories for the team backlog.
Expertise in various business analysis methodologies, including data analysis, use case development, story writing, and user acceptance testing and product documentation.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to understand complex customer needs and translate them into stories with actionable acceptance criteria.
Create drafts of epics and stories to seed backlog in order to begin the refinement process.
Participate in agile ceremonies such as daily stand-ups, sprint planning meetings, demos, and retrospectives.
Mitigate impediments that may impact successful team completion of release/sprint goals.
Experience with Jira or similar Agile backlog management tool.
A successful candidate will have the following characteristics:
Ability to create unmatched experiences, for both clients and employees, is what we do. You should revel in doing the unexpected and extraordinary for others.
A learning mindset, ready to experience new ideas and situations regularly.
Consulting experience is strongly preferred. That said, you will also be considered if you have a strong industry background. We like to work in the communities we live in.
We want someone who likes to solve problems. Clients don’t come to us when the problem is easy. You should enjoy taking on the hard stuff.
And because we work with clients, excellent communication skills are important – both written and verbal. Translating technical concepts into layman’s terms is an essential skill.
Initiative is important. We don’t hand hold – you should be comfortable working independently in an entrepreneurial environment. That said, collaboration is equally important. Our Boston team and other [technologists or consultants] at Centric will give you an amazing support system. You will lean on them daily.
Last, but not least, you will need to be an experienced Business Analyst. We are looking for people with a proven track record and with at least 5+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst in a consulting environment. You must have experience with examining business systems and processes to identify user needs, document requirements, epics, and stories, and address operational issues.
What makes Centric different?
Special Culture – Our people make us different. We have highly talented, intelligent individuals across a broad variety of disciplines – who are eager to learn from you and share their own expertise. We embrace fresh perspectives and each other. Don’t take our word for it – check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to get a glimpse inside what makes us different.
Growth opportunities – As a mid-size firm, there is more flexibility when it comes to career paths. Figure out what you want to do and we'll help you figure out how to get there.
Impact – We think of ourselves as a big company with a small company feel – a local player with global reach that combines business, technology and industry expertise.
Unmatched Experiences – We are allowed to be ourselves here. We are encouraged to be human. It’s at the root of who we are as a firm and why we’re here.
Innovation – We value passion, determination, perseverance, and innovation. We are inspired because we believe in what we are doing and where we are going.
Passion for the greater good – We are steadfast in our devotion to the communities we serve and in actively promoting employee involvement in community improvement projects.
Centric believes the best solutions come from diverse teams. We strive to have an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be successful regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity.
