At Celerity, our focus is on bringing synergies to business process, technology, and creative chops to deliver inspirational solutions. We love giving kudos and celebrating achievements. We provide an inclusive and flexible environment that fosters collaboration, quick pivots, and quality work.

Originally founded in 2002, Celerity was acquired in 2015 by AUSY, a France-based IT consultancy and engineering services firm. With 8 regional offices and 400+ employees, Celerity’s clients span a variety of industries including media and entertainment, healthcare, financial services, manufacturing, non-profit, and hospitality.

You can also get to know us better on Instagram, Facebook, Dribbble, LinkedIn, and Twitter.

Description

Red Collar Pet Foods is looking for an Operations Analyst Coordinator to join our exciting pet treat business in our offices located in Joplin, Missouri. Who is Red Collar? We are pet people, and to us pets are family. We believe that they deserve good food made with wholesome and balanced nutrition in every bag and bowl. It is our commitment to quality ingredients and manufacturing exclusively in the U.S. which makes us all proud of our company and the pets we ultimately feed.

The Operations Analyst Coordinator is responsible for assuring that all aspects of the company’s training requirements and policies are adhered to as well as providing management with updated reporting on the training and operations programs. This position is required to complete instructor lead training sessions and orientations. This position works closely with all divisions within the company.

Principal Accountabilities:
Primary job functions are conducting and maintaining the company’s training and certification programs to include hands on, classroom and recertification training
Provides analytical, reporting and miscellaneous support to management team
Maintains and ensures that the training database is up to date with current training requirements and certifications; requests certifications to be recertified before expiration occurs
Supports the engineering team with supplying reports, data entry and hands on needs
Responsible for analyzing, generating, quantifying, maintaining and publishing key information and reports on special projects
Safely and efficiently performs routine and defined tests on inbound ingredients, work in progress and finished product
Responsible for observing, identifying and recording overall conditions and incidents regarding project job tasks
Adhere to established GMP, Food Safety, Safety and Sanitation guidelines, practices and policies
Ensures that the standards of personal conduct and hygiene are maintained at all times in order to comply with the HPP Food Safety Policy Statement and report food safety issues to the management staff
Maintain clean and safe work environment and housekeeping requirements
Perform other duties as needed/assigned/required

Job Description


Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Reston, VA

Job Function:

We are seeking a Data Analyst, Data Science to mine our large-scale data sets (2+ trillion data records/month) and provide insights to help inform our clients strategy in launching and analyzing marketing campaigns around the world. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analysis, design, and development of Cross-Platform audience measurement products. Their work will have a direct impact on driving business strategies for prominent industry leaders. Were a small but powerful team of data junkies, analyzing over 20 TB of data each day to deliver product and research solutions to our clients.

What You'll Do:
Utilize SQL, Python, as well as Hadoop, Scala, Spark, and many other tools for various projects
Work with Product Management on what problems to tackle and collaborate with Data Science and Core Processing Engineering/Operations teams to create solutions
Design prototype solutions for data processing and methodologyDrive analytical projects that span across multiple teams and functions
Build, test new features and concepts and integrate into production process
Participate in ongoing research and evaluation of new technologies
What You'll Need:
Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems, or similar quantitative discipline
1-3 years of professional experience in data analysis and problem solving with Big Data
1-3 years of professional experience with SQL, Scala, AWS, Hive, Spark, R and/or Python, etc.
Self-motivation and strong communication skills are both must havesYou will need to be comfortable working in a fast-paced work environment with shifting priorities, vague requirements, and rapid iterations
Ability to think creatively and solve complex problems
Ability to autonomously manage simultaneous projects in a fast-paced business environment
Excellent verbal, written and computer communication skills with strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Ability to consistently meet data expectations
Ability to manage change, course correct, and respond decisively
Ability to take on new responsibilities with ease
Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms.

With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry’s emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement.

NCSOFT is focused on making high-quality, cutting-edge, and conceptually innovative Massively Multiplayer Games. NCSOFT is a great place to work, fostering creativity and collaboration. A casual, friendly work environment, comprehensive benefits package, a competitive salary, and more are all part of what makes NCSOFT a great place to work. If you love making great games and have the skills to make it happen, then NCSOFT is the place for you.

NCSOFT is seeking a talented Data Analyst to work across multiple released and unreleased titles. This position is responsible for collecting data, generating reports, and analyzing player behavior.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze game systems, economies, and player behavior to drive game development and business practices that maximize player enjoyment and profitability
Understand, analyze, and predict trends in player data.
Collect and help to elaborate on data reporting requirements, primarily from game design, customer service, and business departments.
Generate reports from accumulated data using SQL, Excel, R, Python and Tableau, as well as defining automated procedures related to data collection.
Communicate findings, actionable recommendations, and data limitations to stakeholders to facilitate data-driven decisions.
Formulate process improvement suggestions through ad hoc analyses and data mining.
Take ownership of data integrity to ensure that the data are correctly supporting the analyses and recommendations being proposed.
Develop new insights and analyses that inform decisions and help us continue to improve gameplay
Analyze game-specific data and pro-actively make recommendations to Product Managers, Game Producers, Game Designers and UX Designers
Devise and run game-specific A/B tests to directly and indirectly drive KPI improvements
Work collaboratively with the Business Intelligence team to share best practices, problem solve and deliver large projects on time.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field, or equivalent experience with data analytics
Experience using SQL to query for and to aggregate data
Understanding of game design and in-game economies
Strong communications skills and ability to work on a team
Ability to change directions quickly based on business, project, and team needs
Ability to effectively communicate complex findings and ideas simply
Drive quality improvements of team's code through reviews and feedback
Experience using descriptive and inferential statistics to analyze and present findings
Experience using visualization techniques for presenting data and analysis
Experience working with business teams to identify and define problems
PLUSES:
Previous mobile game analytics experience
Experience with big data software like Hadoop
Experience with other Business Intelligence backend and analytics applications
This is a full time, on-site position at our studio in San Mateo, CA. A casual, friendly work environment, comprehensive benefits package, a competitive salary, and more are all part of what makes NCSOFT West a great place to work.

Position Description

The Data Analyst will provide intermediate programming and database management support of scientific studies, dashboards, and complex data requests utilizing the OPTN and/or other research databases. The Data Analyst must organize complex clinical and operational data from multiple sources in support of the development of meaningful and impactful reports, data products, and data sets to support the Research department in the completion of contract deliverables, special research projects, and other scientific inquiry.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, manage, and document project-specific analytic datasets and analytics data marts with some guidance or supervision. Merge data files from different platforms and sources using intermediate linkage where needed. Respond to routine requests for data analyses and reports with some guidance or supervision. This includes discussion and interpretation of the results with both internal and external requestors. About Us:


The United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS) coordinates the nation’s organ transplant system, providing vital services to meet the needs of men, women and children awaiting lifesaving organ transplants. Based in Richmond, Va., UNOS is a private, nonprofit membership organization.

UNOS members encompass every transplant hospital, tissue matching laboratory and organ procurement organization in the United States, as well as voluntary health and professional societies, ethicists, transplant patients and organ donor advocates.

Agency Statement: No Agencies Please.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Supply Chain Specialist reviews and analyzes purchase requisitions and supplier quotes for the procurement of goods and services. Responsible for procurement business system data input and integrity. Participates in maximizing the procurement teams' changes, part parameters; item maintenance, supplier database information, error report analysis, and part number/supplier code information. Recommends new supply sources where vendors and suppliers are no longer competitive. Recommend cost-saving proposals including make-versus-buy analysis or alternative sourcing. Interacts closely with suppliers and QA to resolve quality issues. Works with management to address all aspects of commodity management, including procurement support, commodity business plans, market trends assessment, pricing, and product availability. Resolves issues with regards to material delivery, receiving, and payment for goods or services. Develops Category Plans for specific commodity.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Coordinate purchasing activities with manufacturing, planning and PDO departments to acquire inventory in a cost effective and timely manner.
Process purchase requisitions, purchase change orders and requests for quotes to suppliers.
Perform cost analysis and volume planning for major commodities (e.g., materials, components, equipment and services).
Monitor the cost, schedule and scope of assigned subcontracts to negotiate highest quality at best value.
Analyze material requirements to ensure uninterrupted flow of materials and services for designated commodity/part families for production.
Establish and supervise production scheduling activities by monitoring material inventories, tracking progress of production and reviewing factors that affect schedules.
Maintain operational KPIs for department.
Organize and actively participate on Supplier Business Reviews.
Involved on new product launch as needed.
Responsible of timely execution of MRO process.
Expedite, delay, or cancel orders as needed.
Gather, evaluate, and negotiate quotations from suppliers for goods and services.
Execute RFPs and RFQs.
Enter purchase requisitions to support procurement activities.
Manage Open Order Report process to support Vendor On-Time Delivery (OTD).
Generate reports to provide status updates on task, projects, and deliverables.
Identify, develop and manage effective relationships with existing and potential suppliers of goods and services to meet the established cost, quality and delivery targets.
Negotiate price and delivery terms with suppliers to minimize material cost, inventory levels, and transportation costs while supporting production demand requirements.
Manage procurement of assigned components including order placement, expediting & discrepant material resolution.
Create and maintain reports as needed to monitor inventory levels and support production schedules.
Mitigate material shortages and/or planning work order delays through direct involvement with production resources and suppliers.
Communicates with appropriate departments, when problems are suspected or become evident.
Interfaces with Accounts Payable, to resolve invoicing discrepancies.
Interfaces with Manufacturing and Quality to disposition discrepant material. Coordinates Vendor Returns.
Communicates with all departments when possible improvements can be made, such as quantity discounts, or other cost savings.
Ensures compatibility of unit of measure, cost, and quantity when entering purchase orders on ERP system.
Negotiates with suppliers to resolve problems, expedite deliveries, address quality issues, and modify purchase orders as required.
Visits Suppliers facilities for improvement initiatives and problem solving.
Complies with all FDA and Quality Systems Requirements (QSR) requirements.
All work is subject to additional requests as assigned.
Employee must complete training relating to HIPAA/PHI privacy, General Policies and Procedure Compliance training and security training as soon as possible but not later than the first 30 days of hire.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors degree in Business, Economics, Supply Chain, related field, or equivalent.
A minimum of 3 years of purchasing experience is required, preferably in Laboratory related field.
Dynamics Great Plains ERP experience is preferred.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

In depth knowledge of ERP systems and Supply Chain business processes; knowledgeable on the procure to pay process.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and show unique attention to detail and work in a fact paced work environment
Advanced in use of Microsoft Office Suite of Applications (Word, Excel, and Power Point); Advanced Microsoft Excel user.
Excellent organizational, multi-tasking, communication, collaboration, presentation and interpersonal skills.
Team player who will go to great lengths to ensure success for the department and Natera.
Flexibility and adaptability to evolving priorities while working in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrates effective verbal and written communication.
Works collaboratively with others.
Holds self personally accountable to meet or exceed team expectations.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT
Work takes place in an office setting.
At times may be required to work outside normal working hours.
Some travel may be required, up to 10%.
OUR OPPORTUNITY

Driven by the passion for elevating the science and utility of genetic testing, Natera is committed to helping families identify and manage genetic diseases. Natera is a rapidly-growing diagnostics company with proprietary bioinformatics and molecular technology for analyzing DNA. Our complex technology has been proven clinically and commercially in the prenatal testing space and we are actively researching its applications in the liquid biopsy space for developing products with oncology applications.

The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, youll work hard and grow quickly. Working alongside the elite of the industry, youll be stretched and challenged, and take pride in being part of a company that is changing the landscape of genetic disease management.

WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive Benefits. Generous Employee Referral program. Healthy catered lunches 3 times per week, and premium snacks! Additionally, we offer complimentary premium coffee drinks and teas, and other beverages.

For more information, visit www.natera.com.

Natera is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace environment, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Inclusive collaboration benefits our employees, our community and our patients, and is critical to our mission of changing the management of disease worldwide.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.

Job Status – Full Time

Location – Bangor, ME

What working with us is like

C&L Aviation Group is not your typical aviation company. We believe strongly that healthy wages and a happy work environment contribute to a better quality of life, and as such that quality is reflected in your work. At C&L, you’re more than just a pair of hands. You’re an integral part of our team and future growth plans. As such, there is an opportunity for you to improve and advance with our company.

A Better Relationship

Good employees don’t leave jobs, they leave bad bosses. Our talented and trained leadership team cares about you, and your success at C&L. They strive to stay engaged with you to make sure you’re happy and achieving your goals and potential. They also manage by leading and working collaboratively with everyone. This atmosphere leads to happier employees, better work and a respected reputation with our customers.

A Bright Future

It sounds cheesy, but we want your future to shine so brightly that you need shades. Here at C&L, we provide an atmosphere that fosters both personal and professional growth. Our future here at C&L is bright too. In fact, our 25-year old company has grown from one guy selling aircraft parts out of his basement to now over 200 people, with a 140,000 Sq. Ft Facility offering parts sales, aircraft heavy maintenance, avionics installations, engineering, interior refurbishments, exterior paint, component repair, and aircraft sales.

It’s been a great ride so far and we plan to keep growing. We need your help to do that. Right now, we have hit a point where we are at capacity turning work away – we need more people! Together, we can continue with our growth plans.

A Bigger Vision

We feel very fortunate to be able to grow the way we have. Because of that, we want to provide opportunities for employees to participate in making a difference in the community around us. The best way for us to do that is to help the community around grow with us. That’s why we have adopted a local school, helped fund a local community garden, provide holiday meals for those in need and purchased winter coats for area children.

If you have a particular way you like to give back to others less fortunate, we would love to hear about it, and work together to integrate that into our existing charitable programs.

About the Area

You’ll find Bangor, Maine area is a great place to live and play. It’s a small community of roughly 100,000 people, and the commercial and social center of Northern and Eastern Maine. It is the region’s largest center of retail and service businesses and home to great schools and Universities, College sporting events, a vibrant nightlife and several exceptional event and concert venues.

This is a Full-Time Position and includes the following benefits:
Medical
Dental
Life Insurance
Long-Term and Short-Term Disability
401k

Bachelor's degree is required, ideally in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's Degree (preferred).
2+ years of inventory planning, inventory analysis, inventory forecasting, supply chain analysis or planning, distribution planning, or a similar function, preferably in healthcare.

Strong analytical skills specifically around analyzing historical trends, data mining, and handling large datasets using Infor/Lawson, Microsoft Excel, Macros, Visual Basic, Crystal Reports, SQL, Access, or Tableau.
Detail oriented and high-energy, with strong organizational and time management skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Work across departments and have the ability to see the "big picture."

Knowledge of ERP and procurement systems, preferably Infor/Lawson.

job_title: IT Business Relationship Lead III - Supply Chain Collaboration
job_description:
McCormick & Company, Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor and seasonings industry, is seeking a full time IT Business Relationship Analyst III - Supply Chain Collaboration. This new hire will work in the Global Headquarters, located at 24 Schilling Road, Suite 1 in Hunt Valley, MD. The IT Business Relationship Analyst III - Supply Chain Collaboration will report to a VP of IT Business Solutions.

With more than $5 billion in annual sales, the Company manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry â€“ retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food flavored by McCormick. McCormick makes every moment and meal betterâ„¢

As a company recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services. Benefits include, but are not limited to, tuition assistance, medical, dental, vision, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing, paid holidays and vacations.

This new role is responsible for driving value and best practice for McCormick from the Ariba Supply Chain Collaboration capabilities. In this new and evolving space, the incumbent will play a lead IT role in the ongoing solution design, overseeing the configuration and global deployment of the solution as part of the McCormickâ€™s enterprise business transformation project and beyond.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serve as IT lead, providing functional and technical for Supply Chain Collaboration, including Ariba and related technologies, projects and enhancements.
Foster and maintain good relationships with Purchasing and Supply chain key stakeholders to deliver solutions that align with business strategy and vision, in line with the McCormick technology roadmap.
Primary liaison to business and IT systems workstream leaders to work with the integrator team on defining and configuring collaboration solutions, addressing business objectives, enabling efficiencies and influencing business Long Term Plan with technology subject matter expertise.
Keep up to date with the SCC solution roadmap and capabilities as they evolve. Identify streamlining and optimization opportunities while maximizing effectiveness.
Analyse and translate business requirements to systems scope and requirements, considering application of industry best practices and new technologies. Develop project systems scope, estimates and objectives.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum 5 years, experience of SAP ECC configuration and processes, including:
Standard Direct Purchasing
Scheduling agreement release
Subcontracting/Contract Manufacturing
Third party/Drop ship
Service
Invoice Management
Vendor consignment
MRP process
Quality Notification
2 years of SAP Ariba Network hands-on experience.
1 full lifecycle hands-on role with SAP Ariba Commerce automation (PO and Invoice).
Global business and functional acumen: able to understand the complexity of supply chain business on a global scale.
Experience with Supplier Onboarding and buyer network rule collaboration with Ariba Buyer.
Practical understanding of ERP and systems integration via middleware and direct connect
Awareness of the sell side of the Ariba network
Excellent organizational and verbal communication skills; outstanding problem-solving skills and sound judgment.
Demonstrated written communication skills, specifically, documentation of system design, configuration, and process specifications
Expertise in delivery, process management and business systems requirements definition.
University degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science or related discipline.
Ability to influence.
Passion to drive globally standard processes and best practices.
Continuous and keen learner.
Proficiency in English is a must, knowledge of other languages a plus.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Hands-on SAP Ariba Supply Chain Collaboration experience.
CPG, Food & Beverage and/or life science industry experience.
S4 HANA and/or SAP IBP experience.
Knowledge of Buyer CIG or previous cloud integration.
McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

As a general policy, McCormick does not offer employment visa sponsorships upon hire or in the future.

Summary

The SEO Analyst performs website audits and develops related recommendations to ensure SEO best practice compliance. The SEO Analyst reports directly to the Director of Tech SEO and indirectly to the Account Manager(s) of his/her respective customer team(s).

This role will be open to candidates on-site in Syracuse, NY or remote employees in all US states.

Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the following essential functions:
Performs website audits and develops related recommendations to ensure SEO best practice compliance.
Provides advanced site structure and performance recommendations (including information architecture, navigation, design, conversion, etc.).
Provides competitive and market opportunity analyses as they relate to search intent, competitor niche saturation, backlink profiles, and SERP anomalies.
Helps define content strategy for new and existing clients by adding in-depth, content-related recommendations to on-page reviews.
Develops monthly performance reports using programs like Google Analytics, Omniture SiteCatalyst, Excel and others as needed.
Effectively communicates to internal and external stakeholders the opportunity for, and value of, website changes, updates, and content revisions.
Collaborates and works closely with the account teams to ensure key objectives are met while ensuring brand consistency.
Travels to on-site meetings as necessary.
The above description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills
Three or more years of professional work experience in a related role with exposure to how marketing campaigns impact natural search visibility.
Strong understanding of search engine algorithms and ranking methods.
Experience identifying key performance indicators and success metrics given knowledge and understanding of client-specific business goals.
Experience deriving technical insight from Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and directly from SERPs.
Knowledge of technical, usability and content-related aspects of a website and their impact on search.
Proven ability to interact successfully with cross-functional teams and build collaborative relationships.
Demonstrated ability to articulate and deliver reports or recommendations to internal and external stakeholders.
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Information Technology, Business or a related field.
EEO Statement


Terakeet provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

TITLE:

Integrity & Compliance Data Analyst

Title:Integrity & Compliance Data Analyst

Reports To:Director, Compliance Risk Monitoring & Analytics

Location: Richmond, VA

Indivior is a global specialty pharmaceutical company with a 20-year legacy of leadership in patient advocacy, health policy and evidence-based best practice models that have revolutionized modern addiction treatment. The name is the blend of the words individual and endeavor, and the tagline “Focus on you” makes the company’s commitment clear. It represents and empathizes with the often-difficult journey each individual patient takes to overcome the challenges of addiction – a chronic relapsing disease.

Indivior is dedicated to transforming addiction from a global human crisis to a recognized and treated chronic disease. The Indivior logo radiates its patient-focused, holistic focus on expanding access to quality treatment for addiction worldwide. The company has a strong pipeline of products and candidates designed to both expand on its heritage in global opioid dependence and address other chronic diseases of addiction – including opiate overdose, alcohol use disorders and cocaine intoxication - as well as related mental health disorders such as schizophrenia.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The responsibilities of this job include, but are not limited to, the following:

Support the development of Indivior Integrity & Compliance (I&C) Program multi-year compliance data analytics strategy, this includes but is not limited to:
In collaboration with IT and other relevant functions (e.g., Internal Audit, Business Analytics), define and support the development of the Business Information Architecture
Develop risk-based use cases to guide the use of analytics in compliance risk management
Lead the phased acquisition of all data sources, within an aligned prioritization
Serve as primary developer and administrator for identified solutions
Leverage data to tell a story via the creation of compelling visualizations
Identify and engage with external experts in the development of data lake, data cleansing, and data mapping (e.g., data scientist)
Design and evolve I&C’s management reporting tools, this includes but is not limited to:
Transition current dashboards from manual to automated generation
Develop tailored dashboards for different audiences/levels of management
Continually refine and integrate new/adjusted visualizations to best inform regarding status and results
Support I&C in the evaluation, strategic proposal, and implementation of a comprehensive, fit for purpose Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) tool solution

Collaborate across functions and within I&C to access relevant data and information for data analytics, management reporting, and as inputs to annual Risk Assessment and Management Planning (RAMP)

Provide technical support to the I&C Risk Management, Monitoring & Analytics Center of Excellence (COE) in relation to RAMP tool administration and development of data feeds, as well as recommending and leveraging industry standard tools for integration and evaluation of data to drive risk-based, analytics-informed audit and monitoring activities
Support the COE with effective data analytic tools to assess detailed transaction and record reviews
Assist with development, implementation and continuous improvement of processes and systems that drive compliant behavior and enable effective monitoring, including by performing system and data testing and performing any other tasks assigned to ensure accuracy and completeness.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education: MMINIMUMBachelor's Degree, preferably in Information Management, Healthcare Information, Computer Science, Statistics or related field
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools, including but not limited to SQL, Qlikview, Tableau, Cognos, Visual Basic
Data science degree and work experience is a plus
Candidates with experience in Pharmaceutical and Medical Device industries will be given strong preference
Proficiency in MS Office especially in EXCEL and ACCESS
Working knowledge of SAP, Veeva and Concur systems is a plus
TRAVEL:10%

COMPETENCIES/CONDUCT:

In addition to the minimum qualifications, the employee will demonstrate:
Exceptional organizational skills and a keen attention to detail
Proficiency in applied statistics and analytical tools
Strong knowledge of data analysis methodology and data mining techniques
Exceptional experience using data presentation software
Expertise in database development, data gathering and analysis
Experience working with a variety of information systems and data files, including large and complex files
Experience analyzing file structure, using and creating file layouts, transforming raw data into finished products (trending and reports)
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
Strong work ethic and ability to produce high quality, accurate work under significant deadline pressures
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and cross functionally
Strong communication skills with ability to communicate effectively with individuals in various functions
Ability to be proactive, exercise judgment and manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously
Ability to review and analyze financial transactions and/or arrangements that could raise potential compliance issues
Must maintain confidentiality in handling sensitive information
Curiosity and eagerness to learn
Unquestionable ethics and integrity and ability to stand firm on these principles even under significant pressure
BENEFITS:

Indivior is committed to providing a culture driven by guiding principles and top-tier benefits that match the importance of the work we do. The Indivior experience includes
3 weeks’ vacation plus floating holidays and sick leave
401(k) and Profit Sharing Plan- Company match of 75% on your first 6% of contributions discount and profit sharing contribution equal to 4% of your eligible pay
U.S. Employee Stock Purchase Plan- 15% Discount
Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability coverage
Health and Dependent Care Flex Spending options
Adoption assistance
Tuition reimbursement
Leverage concierge/personal assistance services
Voluntary benefits including Legal, Pet Insurance and Auto/Home coverage
Gym, fitness facility and cell phone discounts
Our Guiding Principles, Core Values and Vision provide a culture that unites and guides our employees.
GUIDING PRINCIPLES:

Indivior’s guiding principles are the foundation for each employee’s success and growth. Each employee is expected to demonstrate understanding and adherence to our guiding principles in their everyday performance.

The duties and responsibilities identified in this position description are considered essential but are not limited to only those outlined. The employee may perform other functions that may be assigned. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of this position at any time.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disabled

City Beauty, LLC is looking to fill the Supply Chain Analyst role that is responsible for production planning, component inventory planning and the management of finished goods inventory coverage at both warehouse locations. This role will also manage all purchasing functions at City Beauty. This role will be responsible to negotiate and process purchase orders to meet specialized or complex needs. Make purchase decisions in accordance with company procedures, regulations and needs. Collaborate with department managers to clarify purchase requisitions, identify departmental needs, and refine specifications for future purchase orders. Follow proper channels to obtain purchase authorization according to company policy and investigate and cultivate new sources for supplies and products. The job description is as follows:
Develop cost savings initiatives and assist in the identification and execution of cost reduction strategies
Use forecast and supply programs/tools to ensure supply of finished good items to maintain target inventory levels at multiple warehouse locations.
Forecast and plan weekly finished good production, inventory on hand, orders in transit and customer orders.
Lead Open Order Calls with Co-manufacturers to ensure requested delivery dates are met and monitor weekly updates provided.
Work closely with transportation team to know when the product is shipping and communicate to the business as needed.
Utilize and suggest improvements to analytical tools and processes to support forecast development.
Effectively communicate with co-manufacturing partners of supply needs and any changes to production requirements.
Lead regular meetings with various commercial groups to enrich forecast and supply planning (Media Planning, Copywriting, Product Development, etc.).
Support Product Development team for product launches with production planning updates.
Act as a liaison between the company, warehouse and vendors.
SKU Entry/Creation
Partner with Coders & Media Buyers to ensure products discontinuing/out of stock
Manage SKU Conversion
Address Backorders - troubleshooting issues with SKUÃ¢s
Day-to-day order placement, tracking, and follow-up
Complete requests for quotes by identifying and selecting vendors and suppliers using criteria such as quantity and quality of commodities, price, and delivery date

At American Family Insurance, we’re driven by our customers and employees. That’s why we provide more than just a job – we provide opportunity. Whether you’re already part of our team in search of a new challenge or new to our company and ready for what’s next, you’re in the right place. Job ID:
R16410 Data Reporting Analyst (Open)
Summary:
Job Family Summary

Provides analytics services to the business. Develops new insights and understands the business performance based on data and statistical methods. Analyzes business results, external market dynamics and other data sources to assess trends and develop actionable insights and recommendations to management, via understanding of the business model and the information available for analysis. Typically uses data, statistical and quantitative analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, and fact-based management to drive decision making.

Job Description:


Level Summary
Requires in-depth conceptual and practical knowledge in own job discipline and basic knowledge of related job disciplines
Solves complex problems
Works independently, receives minimal guidance
May lead projects or project steps within a broader project or may have accountability for on-going activities or objectives
Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience
Level at which career may stabilize for many years or until
Primary Accountabilities
Conducts accurate and timely business analysis and reporting to support and drive business decisions using statistical modeling and other business analysis tools.
Collaborates with key stakeholders to define key financial and operational metrics to continuously monitor, track, and report performance.
Collaborates with business partners in the development and delivery of key performance analysis and reporting.
Builds and maintains models used to project business results; enhances the model where there is business value in adjusting the models.
Ensures analysis and reporting accuracy and integrity and explains performance drivers and provides insights into performance trends.
Analyzes and addresses data quality issues, tests and analyzes impact of system changes to data/reporting infrastructure.
Develops, tests, and deploys automated reporting solutions and automated decision analytics to replace manual business processes.
Specialized Knowledge and Skill Requirements
Demonstrated experience providing customer-driven solutions, support or service
Solid knowledge and understanding of forecasting techniques or statistical analysis
Demonstrated strong experience utilizing data tools to build complex formulas and create reports
Understanding of software tools to query and report data
Knowledge of a variety of standard reporting software packages and best practices for report deployment processes
Demonstrated experience developing data sets
Travel Requirements
This position requires travel up to 10% of the time.
Additional Job Information:


This posting is reflective of two positions: one supporting Product Management (reports to Ryan Resetar) and one supporting Underwriting/Services Operations (reports to Paul Reeter). The role relies on data collection, data preparation, data visualization and reporting techniques to support analysis and decision making at American Family Insurance. The analyst must be able to think critically and independently manage/tackle a variety of complex requests. Prime candidates will have solid experience with relational databases and the ability to collect business requirements and work with stakeholders to develop automated data solutions with a high focus on quality. This role is ideal for an individual who has a passion for using data to drive decision making in a corporate environment and is comfortable working autonomously and professionally to meet deadlines. This position has accountability to producing insights for a variety of levels of consumers throughout the organization which requires different approaches and level of detail with each deliverable.

Tools/code languages used within the role include but aren't limited to: SQL, Tableau, Python, SAS, and VBA.

Based on candidate qualifications, we are open to hiring at other levels within the job family.

Offer to selected candidate will be made contingent on the results of applicable background checks.

Offer to selected candidate is contingent on signing a non-disclosure agreement for proprietary information, trade secrets, and inventions.

Relocation assistance is available.

Candidate must have the capability and connectivity to work remotely.

Stay connected: Join our Talent Community!

Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for an Associate Cost Estimating Analyst to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals in Melbourne, Florida.
Essential Functions:
Candidates for this position will support estimating activities of diverse and inclusive teams with high levels of engagement and collaboration with other team members.
They will demonstrate a broad skill set that is balanced across interpersonal, business, and tool based capabilities; a commitment to ethics and integrity; and the capability to innovate in a challenging and dynamic environment.
Develops Production Cost Estimates (PCEs) and presents findings to management.
Supports Affordability Review Boards (ARBs).
Bridges current costs to future projections by normalizing data.
Monitors and updates major contract deliverable.
Conducts risk assessment on production costs and program proposals (e.g. Monte-Carlo analysis).
Provides Long Range Strategic Plan (LRSP) inputs.
Automates data collection for analysis (e.g. Tableau).
Creates cost models for cost estimating elements.
Reviews change review board packages for production impacts.
Develops automated Pricing & Estimating (P&E) tools.
The selected candidate should thrive in a fast-paced work environment with high expectations

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university with professional experience in Business Administration, Estimating, Finance, Project Management or related field OR
Master's Degree from an accredited university with professional experience in Business Administration, Estimating, Finance, Project Management or related field.
Experience working with Excel.
Must be able to obtain and maintain DoD Secret Clearance.
Must be able to obtain Special Program Access.
Preferred Qualifications:
A current DoD Secret or Top Secret security clearance
Proficient in using Tableau
Experience conducting cost analysis and risk modeling
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to effectively manage competing priorities and deadlines
Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast paced environment
Excellent problem solving and organizational skills

FanDuel Group is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media, including FanDuel, Betfair US, and TVG. FanDuel Group has a presence across 45 states and 8 million customers. The company is based in New York with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon, and Scotland.

About the role

Responsible for the delivery of key actionable insights that drive the development of industry leading Customer Operations. This ranges from driving business impact based on customer behavioral data, to using data insights to report on, and help streamline operational processes that affect customer experience.

As a Data Analyst sitting with the Customer Operations team, you will collaborate with areas such as Customer Support, Fraud and Payments in the detailed analysis of Customer Operations data sets. You will assist in the development and implementation of improvement projects across the business unit, as well as across the company. You will work closely with the Commercial team and data analytics teams by being the source of knowledge for Customer Operations data. You will be responsible for the expansion of Customer Operations data in the business as our department grows to scale.

Essential Functions
Measure and analyze historical Customer Operations data and report on trends
Become a source of knowledge within the business on understanding the relationship between customer interaction data and the value driven by customer operations performance data
Conduct research and analysis into the primary drivers of customer contacts.
Assisting the team with completing ad-hoc insights requests from the business
Required Qualifications:

Behavioral Competencies
Positive approach and attitude to change and embrace opportunity as it arises
Ability to work under pressure and under own initiative
Confidence to deal with issues and problems as they arise in a proactive and professional manner
Ability to work as part of a team
A willingness to challenge and think differently
Ability to meet deadlines and business demands
Excellent communication skills
Technical Competencies
Analytical and problem solving skills based on a data driven approach
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel and Power Point.
Data manipulation and extraction skills are desired using some or all of: SQL, Redshift & Aurora, Oracle DW, MS SQL Server, including some skill in data visualization in data visualization tools such as Tableau.
Ability to take large swathes of information and present it to non-experts in a highly visual format
Knowledge of the betting & gaming industry is desired
Inclined to learn data analysis tools and languages
Education, Qualifications & Experience
1-2 years in a relevant Data Analyst role is essential
Relevant degree qualification desirable
Knowledge and understanding of the sports and online gaming industry
Must be able to attain required regulatory licensure(s)
What you get in return

Beyond working with such a great team?
An exciting environment with real growth
Contribute to exciting products used by a highly passionate user base
Personal learning and development opportunities
Flexible vacation allowance
401k with company match
Attractive health insurance premiums
There's more, but we don't want to go on and on.

FanDuel Group is an equal opportunities employer. Diversity and inclusion in FanDuel means that we respect and value everyone as individuals. We don't tolerate bias, judgement or harassment. Our focus is on developing employees so that they reach their full potential.

We Are Hiring

Sr. Data Analyst- Nashville, TN

Join a team that is cutting edge in data and analytics technology and the hub for transformation from fee-for-service to value-based care!

Why Join Ascension?
Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the leading non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, especially to those most in need. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs.

Ascension includes approximately 156,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. The national health system operates more than 2,600 sites of care – including 151 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities – in 21 states and the District of Columbia, while providing a variety of services including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension’s own group purchasing organization.

What You Will Do

As an Associate with Ascension, you will have the opportunity to serve as key resource/SME in collection and analysis of data from multiple sources for the development of reports and statistical information.

Responsibilities:

• Compiles analytical and statistical reports as needed.
• Oversees provision of ad hoc management reports.
• Reviews information for accuracy and reconciles data on a regular basis.
• Proficiency with data extraction, manipulation, and interpretation using multiple data sources (EMR, claims, ayer data).
• Translate business requests into actionable reports.
• Develops and prepares the required and/or requested reports, charts and graphs Analyzes claims and clinical loss data for trends and identifies opportunities for additional evaluation and focus.
• Conducts data analysis to assist Health Ministries and System Office staff in defining key performance indicators, measurement and management improvement Collaborates with IT Division regarding the system requirements and necessity for accurate, timely reports and access to claims information Reviews National Benchmarking studies, focused on claims and clinical loss prevention.
• Develops approaches to presenting information including presentations and communications. Supports advance project management, improvement initiatives and tactical decisions/plans.
• Analyzes healthcare data from conceptualization through presentation of data and proficiency with analytical tools, knowledge of data analysis methodology, use of presentation software and strong communication skills.
• Develops and provides visual, spoken and written education related to data analysis, data presentation, including information/education related to maximizing the use of data products and functions across Ascension.
• Supports database applications and analytical tools including evaluation of data quality, appropriate use of applications and maximizing internal and external database product functions across Ascension.

What You Will Need

Education:
High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree required.
Bachelor's Degree in Health/ Business Administration, Public Health or Statistics strongly preferred.
Work Experience:
3 years of experience in a related healthcare field with knowledge of the healthcare industry.
5 plus years of data analytics experience.
Experience with HEDIS or Risk Adjustments initiatives preferred.
SQL and Tableau experience preferred.

Job Family Summary

The Data Services team supports the implementation of Benefits products onto enrollment and benefit management platforms. This area works very closely with enrollment and group intake teams, application processing teams and relevant business areas to improve processing reliability. This area also works closely with the sales, account implementation, new business, and premium administration teams to ensure long term processing reliability and improved overall product administration capabilities.

Job Summary

This opportunity will begin by working closely with the Operations team to identify and take advantage of opportunities in enrollment data processing. Opportunities that are identified through operational analysis, data analysis, and direct observation will be documented, analyzed, prioritized, and exploited to improve overall service delivery on the platform and all enrollment platforms.

In coordination with other team members, the incumbent is expected to conduct rapid, efficient analysis of spreadsheets and various data processing platforms, interpret logs, and interview case administration participants to identify errors and attribute root cause.

The incumbent will then work with the team to isolate and correct related errors, and to identify, document, and implement changes to prevent errors from recurring.

This role relies heavily on technical data and process analysis as well as root cause problem solving expertise.



Key Responsibilities

Use all available tools to identify opportunities for improvement in application processing.
Provide direction to file developers on best practice integration with internal processing systems.
Perform system and data feed testing with Enrollment Services Consultants.
Resolve missing applications quickly - and act decisively to ensure the cause is not repeated.
Document issue resolution for team understanding and future analysis.
Collaborate closely with internal business areas and external partners to effectively recognize and solve case level enrollment issues.
Provide technical expertise and guidance to processors and technology partners regarding data strategies to support Benefits products
Support ongoing efforts to increase enrollment platform capabilities
Help define, document and manage case quality standards
Develop, edit, and audit process documentation related to processing and support activities on enrollment processing systems


Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Experience

Communication skills commensurate for both technical and non-technical audiences
Knowledge and understanding of the voluntary benefit enrollment process
Advanced Excel. Knowledge of SQL, macro development, and Javascript/ JScript
Bachelors preferred in the Computer Science or business-related fields or related experience
Advance skills in data testing, auditing, analysis and reporting
Familiarity with Python or similar analysis coding will be preferred
Ability to manage concurrent conflicting priorities
Schedule flexibility to work extended hours during peak volumes
Proactive approach to problem solving and root cause resolution

Beazley is seeking a Data Analyst to develop and analyze management information to support the Group Claims department as well as provide commercial benefit through improvement in claims outcomes. This will include timely and accurate production of management information to assist with claims data analysis. Support on related projects aimed at improving the delivery of management information to the business. Also deliver insight and drive innovation using internal and external data.

Operational Support
Production of regular and ad hoc management information for presentation or distribution to the senior management team, underwriters, directors, members of the board, actuary, etc as required.
Deliver continuous improvement of Management Information reporting, both in terms of the quality of output and the speed of reporting processes.Maintain the standard suite of Management Information reports, making appropriate changes in light of new MI requests and/or operational changes.
Support claims performance measurement / management efforts including production of regular and ad-hoc management information for presentation or distribution to the Team as required, leveraging Excel, Access and/or other reporting tools supported by Beazley.
Prepare, interpret and analyse claims and other statistics in response to ad-hoc requests for information.
Identify and drive opportunities for improving access to information and reports, including activity to drive the usage of BeazleyIntelligence across the group.
Support the claims team in responding to regulatory requests (whether in formal projects or ad hoc requests) through the provision of information or determining how operational processes need to change to meet changing regulatory requirements.


Other Responsibilities
Interact with claims managers, and proactively develop reports to assist the business. Liaise with IT, underwriters, actuaries, accountants, etc. and other areas of the group as required.
Provide active support to relevant business projects, as required, and assist in the development of reporting processes across the organisation.
Participate in and lead meetings as required.
Produce and maintain procedures documentation for own tasks.
Organise papers and reports for meetings as requested by or agreed with the GCMT.
Facilitate knowledge sharing and training for peers within the business.
Conflicts of Interest
Adhere to Beazley’s Conflicts of Interest policy, alert the appropriate person to any potential conflicts of interest and take steps to resolve them promptly.
Immediately advise the Group Head of Claims if any Beazley employee seeks to exert undue influence on you or any other team member to act improperly in the management, reserving or settlement of any claim.
Education and Qualifications

Professional approach to successfully interact with managers/colleagues/external suppliers

Not afraid to ask questions
